Simplesmente JOGAÇO!!!

Basicamente é um jogo de Farm misturado com RPG e hordas de zumbis, você tem que upar seu boneco e montar builds para ficar mais forte e poder amassar os zumbis das mais variadas formas possíveis, todas as construções do jogo são feitas com blocos que você mesmo pode usar, ou seja é possível replicar qualquer estrutura que tem no jogo e isso também te possibilita criar qualquer estrutura seja para proteção, guardar itens ou segurar os zumbis na lua de sangue da forma mais eficiente possível.

Detalhe: na época do acesso antecipado era 17 reais uma key no Eneba e as promoções aqui ficavam em torno de 27 reais, acho que foi um vacilo dos devs lançarem oficialmente por esse preço de 121 reais, até porque na realidade o lançamento não mudou muita coisa de fato, basicamente fizeram mudanças em algumas mecânicas mas o jogo em si já teve updates durante o acesso antecipado que foram bem maiores e mais relevantes.

185993368.review:
I have owned this game for about 10 years now, and I would like to share my personal experience with this game, as an OG player from the Alpha stages.

I consider myself to be a survival player, so I feel confident when I say this is a damn good survival game. There are a few bugs, and things that have changed over the MANY years of development, but the developers never stopped listening to us. One thing that made it so hard for me to play over the years, was everytime there was a major update, you would practically need to restart your save to make sure everything ran properly. But now that it is in stable 1.2, I don't have to worry about that, and this game is SO addictive. The graphics in this game have BLOSSOMED since Alpha, and genuinely, with a great graphics card, you can expect some pretty beautiful scenes. The zombies look very much better than they did in Alpha, although I do wish they were a bit cleaner looking, in terms of graphical wise. The looting in this game, isn't exactly linear. You have the very basic story line, with lore elements hidden throughout the map, (which by the way, there is a story map and then several random maps, and then you have the option to develop a random map); or you could just spend your days looting random buildings. The looting throughout cities has changed in the way that if a door is locked, you can normally go through the area and find a hidden story line to the building as you navigate your way through. The challenges was an amazing touch, gives you lots more room for leveling up. The traders having such drastic personalities, has been very fun honestly; the way you interact with them and the jobs you get from them are fun, to me. I love the customization available when building and crafting. The way you advance through, upgrading your base and weapons as the day goes on; I genuinely don't see why anyone would NOT like this game, if you are truly a survival player. This is not for kids, or casual players. Someone told me that they consider this game to be the "Adult Minecraft" and I think that is both funny and accurate. There's crafting, looting, mining, hunting; you don't have to play by yourself either, you can play with randoms on public servers. I can say, with my full chest, this game is worth it. If you don't believe me still, wait for it to go on sale and play with some friends. You won't regret it.

185886314.review:
7 Days to Die is a challenging yet incredibly fun survival game set in a post-apocalyptic world. With over 750 hours played, I can confidently say the mix of scavenging, building, and fending off zombie hordes creates a tense and rewarding experience. The game ramps up in difficulty as you prepare for the Blood Moon hordes, requiring strategic thinking and resource management. While the gameplay can be tough, it’s satisfying to fortify your base and outsmart the undead.

One of the best aspects is the thriving modding community, which adds countless mods to keep things fresh. These mods can completely alter the game, adding new content and mechanics that keep long-time players engaged. The variety of ways to customize your experience is a huge plus for someone who’s played for hours. Despite its occasional technical issues, the game’s open-ended nature and survival depth are what truly make it stand out.

For anyone looking for a fun, challenging survival game with tons of replayability, 7 Days to Die is definitely worth checking out.

185885082.review: immer noch schlechter optimiert als ritze

185885026.review:
El juego no vale la pena, no esta ni medio terminado

Planteamiento: se supone que es el atractivo principal del juego, sobrevivir en un mundo post apocalíptico donde tenes que hacer todo desde cero, lo cual no es mentira pero esta mal planteado, para ejemplo el tutorial, este te guía en los primeros pasos, te enseña a fabricar herramientas, un garrote, arcos, flechas y un poco de combate, luego te deja con la pestaña de desafíos los cuales se suponen te guían por el juego, el problema con esto es que no son desafíos, son logros de grindeo, te piden hacer una acción varias veces que te enseña a "sobrevivir", la comida no es un problema, hay animales por todas partes, en las casas hay varias latas de comida, si bien el agua limpia puede ser un problema encontras agua sucia por todos lados la cual podes purificar en una hoguera si tenes una olla (lo cual puede ser fácil o difícil de conseguir dependiendo del rng), el combate es tosco, los zombies si bien pueden ser un reto no es por dificultad sino porque son esponjas de balas, el saqueo, que suele ser una parte fundamental en este juego, esta mal planteado también, depende mucho del rng, podrías encontrar una desert eagle en una guarderia y encontrar un cuchillo de hueso en una base militar, el juego se hace muy tedioso si se juega solo por la gran cantidad de grindeo que requiere hacer las cosas mas básicas como una base.

El peso es quizás la peor mecánica de "supervivencia" no importa si tenes puro pasto en el inventario tu personaje se va a mover como tortuga, al inicio tenes poco espacio, no sabes que es importante y que no por lo que robas todo, la gran mayoría no te va servir hasta mucho después en la partida pero te lo llevas igual porque sabes que lo vas a necesitar, lo que hace que el personaje siempre este con sobrepeso, te moves a dos por hora, la energia sube lento, los zombies te alcanzan y por no tener energia no podes pelear.

hay otros estados que son de daños secundarios: rosaduras, hemorragias, esguinces, fracturas, infección, disentería, contucion, aturdimiento, etc. suena bien pero la gran mayoria depende del rng para poder tratarlo, no hay punto medio o tenes varios de los items que necesitas almacenados o no tenes ninguno, podes fabricarlos si tenes la habilidad medica suficiente, lo cual se traduce a haber encontrado varias revistas, rng.

no es difícil mantenerte con vida, gran parte del juego se trivializa con usar la mejor arma del juego, el arco y flecha, podes evitar la mayoría de los estados con el arco y flecha.

Combate:

- el combate cuerpo a cuerpo se basa en hacer un tira y afloja con los enemigos, pegas, patras, pegas, patras, y asi todo el rato, tenes los ataques fuertes que hacen mas daño a costa de mas energia y lentitud, tambien los debiles que gastan menos y son mas rapidos, no conviene usar los debiles, aunque los primeros zombis son debiles dos o tres a la vez te van a vaciar la energia o te van a dar varios golpes, los golpes fuertes los paran o tiran al suelo lo que te permite maniobrar mejor.

- el combate a distancia es relativamente bueno, plantea un riesgo-recompensa, podes usar armas de fuego, lo cual te permite mantener distancia con los zombis y hacerle daño a varios objetivos en poco tiempo, el sonido los va a atraer por lo que tenes que pensar bien donde las usas y como, es facil quedarte sin balas, me gustaba ese aspecto, hasta que me centre en el arco y flecha, no hace ruido, no alerta a los zombies, pega terrible critico si logras que no te detecten antes y las flechas son faciles de hacer, le quita la dificultad al juego, si bien se complica con varios enemigos si te detectan podes correr y disparar sin agrandar la orda, la unica situacion donde no combiene usar el arco y pasar a las armas de fuego es cuando ya te detectaron varios zombies o estas en una oleada, fuera de eso el arco es la mejor opcion.

Construccion: lo que suele ser un pilar fundamental de los survival/sandox es la creación de una base a tu gusto, poder crear tu casa, fortificarla, poner defenzas, etc. es posible pero increíblemente tosco, para poder crear una casa que resista mas de una oleada tenes que estar horas farmeando materiales, lo cual se resume a gastar horas picando o cavando para poder tener un recinto de 10x10 que aguante una oleada, las defenzas del juego no sirven como tal, solo realentizan el avance de los zombies, los pinchos y barricadas apenas les hacen daño y las atraviesan, las torretas automaticas estan mal planteadas, solo disparan en linea recta, casi no tienen potencia a menos que encuentres revistas por el mundo y si no las tenes en un terreno elevado/protegido se van a evaporar con las oleadas (despues profundizo).

El ciclo de juego: la mayor parte del juego se basa en hacer una mision, volver al vendedor, reclamar recompensa, repetir hasta que te pida ir con otro vendedor y prepararte para la oleada cada 7 dias, se vuelve muy repetitivo muy rapido

zombies: los basicos son maejables, pero cuando pasan a las variantes rabiosas o cargadas se combierten en esponjas de balas, no son dificiles solo que aguantan mucho y algunos se regeneran, es una forma de dar una dificultad artificial, perdes no porque sea dificil, sino porque aun bajandole dos cargadores no se muere y tiene 14 zombis mas detras.

inteligencia: es inexistente, los zombis solo tiran para adelante, pueden tener la puerta al lado y van a golpear el marco para pasar, la mejor forma de sobrevivir a las oleadas es hacer un torreon alto conectado por un puente roto, los zombies suben por el puente, se caen, vuelven a subir y asi siguen, les disparas desde el torreon 100% seguro o pones las torretas al costado del torreon para que sea una granja afk, entiendo que podes evitarlo pero llega un punto en el que no importa la base que tengas te la van a borrar, son esponjas de balas y se amontonan en grandes cantidades, de nuevo, no es dificil, es tedioso.

el rng: dependes mucho de la suerte para que el juego se haga llevadero, encontrar grandes cantidades de revistas de un mismo tipo para poder hacer mas facil el juego es tedioso, las misiones varian entre darte recompenzas de mierda o el mejor arma que podes tener en ese punto, a veces te dan vehiculos, pero cuando me los dan ya los fabrique hace rato, lo que es un pilar del juego tambien esta mal planteado.

habilidades: se otorga un punto de habilidad por nivel, hay cinco ramas principales, fuerza, vitalidad, destreza, percepcion e inteligencia, cada una sirve para algo pero sinceramente conviene mas centrarse en una y solo tomar las necesarias del resto, yo me centre en destreza para dejar de moverme como un lego, gran parte de las habilidades resuelven problemas que dije anteriormente, lo cual no me gusta, las habilidades deberian aportar a la experiencia de juego,no bloquear parte de la divercion con grindeo, la mayoria de ramas no vale la pena subirlas por el esfuerzo que amerita, centrarse en una es lo mejor, subiendo dos puntos de las otras ramas que te faciliten el grindeo.

el juego solo vale la pena si lo jugas con amigos, los cuales ayudan a reducir drasticamente la cantidad de farmeo y aportan a la experiencia haciendo estupideces pero por si solo el juego es malo.

185882765.review:
I can't play this game anymore. I got no patiences for this. It seems like the game has gotten worst with every version released in the last 3 years. It seems like the developers look at what players are doing and then deem it exploitative or just don't like it in general and change it. To summarize it, they don't like how the players are playing their game and they want them to play it how they (devs) want them to play it.
We went from alpha 12 creating sand molds for glass jars to now as of b25, no glass jars or containers or anything and want you to die of thirst on day one. We use to build underground and be safe, devs didn't like that and now the zombies dig. We then built air forts or off-ground bases, devs didn't like that and added physics to the blocks and coded zombies to attack the nearest support pillar to force collapse.
You use to build a small structure or clear and rehab a point of interest as a starting base after scouting for ones with forges or being near water. Devs didn't like that and now Poi's are deadly, and sometimes spawn zoms inside after placing your land claim block or bedroll. They marketed the game as a crafting survival game, but now have made it difficult to build and craft and forces you to loot all the time. 
You use to eat once and drink 3-4 times a day, devs didn't like that and now You're constantly starving and thirsty all the time. In alpha 12, you use to read books to unlock crafting or recipes and magazines to increase skills, the devs didn't like that and thought a skill point system would be better. They took the book/mags out in alpha 13-18 then reintroduced it in 19 to co-exist with the skill-point system, but now in b25, you need the books and mags to level up for everything.
You use to heal up and regain stamina after eating or drinking, and now you just a weak ass bitch, since food doesn't recover as much health and water is sparse. They cut down or remove quite bit of assets and gameplay from the game to simplify it and I think that has detracted from the game from it's earlier versions.
Now the fun pimps don't like the stealth mechanic and have null and negate it in the latest version.
That's just a fraction of the evolving changes. The game used to be pretty fun to now being such a total grind and chore, that I can't even stand it for 30 minutes before I quit out. 

I know what you're thinking, I'm complaining about how hardcore and difficult then contradict myself with them simplifying crafting and assets. But if you ever play the earlier versions, it wasn't as much of chore then as more of a realism and understanding basic build process, and it was quite fun. There was more to do. Going "oh I need sand and clay, I need a jar for the mold, I need a forge, some metal or an anvil" and put it all together to get 5 glass jars. Then I need water, pot and campfire. It was all obtainable and you had to manage it and it made it felt like you were trying to survive. 

Now it's like, you have to loot and get lucky, Do about 30 hits on a tree, block or door and now you're thirsty because you've exhausted your stamina repeatedly, so don't run or swing your club and avoid zombies, and hope you find water. It's a walking simulator with a looting mechanic. That's just bad game design. 

The Fun Pimps are not so fun, I think they are pure masochists that enjoy C&B Torture and they are making this game for those that enjoy that type of fetish.

Und dank Modersteller, die für geniale Modpacks sorgen, wird mich das Spiel sicher noch weiterhin sehr, sehr lange begleiten! :D
Für mich, eine klare 10/10.

185867992.review:
I have played this game since very early alpha, it has come on leaps and bounds since then. In this day of having a lot of early access games this one did what they needed to do and released, and the game and are constantly making it better. 

The developers went out their way to develop the mechanics several times to find a way to balance the game progression and make it fun and I think the current build has achieved this. I think its great that you have to work hard to master everything and this makes the game great for team work. Me and my friends are only 42 days into a new game the (1.2 build), we made it harder to find things we need so space out what points to use where for our character builds. For those playing single player I would suggest a intelligence build and do missions and trade for your short comings in other areas then decide what weapons you want to use.

Overall I believe this is one of the better zombie survival games out there. 

Now time for the things the devs could improve or things I would like to see;

1; I would like a proper campaign in this game maybe with some more NPC's maybe even build a npc 
    settlement also it lacks hostile survivor NPC's.

2; the gyrocopter is a waste of time it needs to be something better for end game vehicle.

3; More modifications for armor its lacking, cancel that mods for everything lacking and are easy to obtain. (I 
    think the better ones your should be a find only mod) also I want my drone to have a weapon because Siri 
    needs to take her anger our on zombies when you mess up.

4; I would love to see train lines and trains

5; Farming is a waste of time, the time time it takes to farm you might as well just use the simple foods in my 
    opinion the late game farming foods just aren't worth the investment, please make this better.

6; improve blood moon optimisation because the longer you go on the worst the lag can get with huge blood moon hordes (My pc is ten years old now so she's not as optimised as she once was), its playable its just something for the new players to watch out for.

There's other things but its not that important petty little things which will probably come with time and updates.

Thank you and keep safe out there.

‌七日杀是一款结合了生存、射击、建筑与角色扮演元素的开放世界沙盒生存类游戏‌。游戏背景设定在末日世界，玩家需要在被僵尸占领的环境中生存，不断收集资源、建造庇护所、制造武器与工具，并抵御每天夜晚的僵尸大军‌。

游戏玩法和特色
七日杀的核心玩法包括生存与防守。玩家需要在一个充满危险的世界中生存，每经过七天就会迎来一次“血月”挑战，成群结队的僵尸将全力攻击玩家的庇护所。玩家必须为每次“血月”做好充分准备，包括修建防御工事、打造武器和补给食物等‌。此外，游戏还融入了第一人称射击、生存恐怖、塔防和角色扮演等多种元素，提供了丰富的游戏体验‌

7 Days to Die is an incredibly fun and immersive survival experience, especially when played with friends. The game offers a perfect blend of survival mechanics, crafting, base building, and combat, making it easy to lose hours in its addictive gameplay.

One of the best aspects is the sheer amount of interaction in the game. From scavenging and looting to building and defending your base against increasingly challenging hordes, there's always something to do. Every Alpha update brings meaningful improvements, adding new features, refining gameplay, and enhancing the overall experience.

7 Days to Die keeps you coming back for more. It's a game that keeps getting better and deserves a spot in any survival gamer's library!

185805018.review:
Minha visão sobre um dos melhores (e mais desafiadores) jogos de sobrevivência.

Fala, galera! Eu já passei mais de 380 horas no 7 Days to Die, e não dá pra negar que esse jogo é um dos mais completos no gênero de sobrevivência. Ele tem seus altos e baixos, mas, no geral, é aquele tipo de game que te prende de um jeito que, quando você percebe, já é madrugada. Vou contar tudo o que eu achei!

Gráficos e Desempenho
Olha, nessa versão os gráficos deram um salto bem legal, principalmente nos personagens, zumbis e animais. Dá pra ver que a Fun Pimps está trabalhando pra deixar o jogo mais bonito. Ainda tem bastante o que melhorar – especialmente nas texturas de ambiente e no desempenho geral –, mas tá muito mais agradável de jogar.

O problema é que, dependendo do mapa ou da quantidade de construções e hordas, o FPS dá umas sofridas. A otimização ainda não é o forte do jogo, mas, pra mim, isso nunca foi um motivo pra largar.

Sobrevivência: Intensa e Gratificante
O ciclo de sobrevivência é o que mais me prende. Aquela correria no início, tentando achar água, comida e qualquer coisa pra se defender, é super intensa. Eu adoro a tensão de saber que a cada sete dias tem uma horda vindo, e tudo que eu faço precisa me preparar pra isso.

Mas, vou ser sincera: depois que você domina as mecânicas e constrói uma base forte, o jogo perde um pouco do desafio. Fica mais automático, sabe? Ainda assim, é muito divertido.

Exploração: Sempre uma Aventura
Explorar em 7 Days to Die é incrível. Cada bioma tem sua própria cara e dificuldade, e as cidades abandonadas sempre têm aquele loot que faz valer a pena o risco. A sensação de achar um item raro, tipo uma arma top ou uma ferramenta que eu precisava, é maravilhosa.

O único problema é que, depois de tantas horas, eu comecei a perceber um padrão nos prédios. Muitos deles têm layouts repetidos, o que tira um pouco da emoção de explorar. Ainda assim, eu nunca canso de sair por aí com a mochila quase explodindo de tanto loot.

Construção: Criatividade
Se tem uma coisa que 7 Days to Die faz muito bem, é a construção. Dá pra montar desde uma base simples até uma fortaleza cheia de armadilhas malucas. A física do jogo é um ponto alto – se você não reforçar a estrutura, pode desabar, e sim, eu já aprendi isso da pior forma. 😅

Por outro lado, coletar recursos pode ser cansativo em longas sessões de jogo. Às vezes eu sinto que passo mais tempo quebrando pedra e coletando madeira do que construindo de fato.

Hordas: Um Show de Tensão
As hordas são, pra mim, o melhor e o pior do jogo. Melhor porque elas trazem aquela adrenalina absurda. Pior porque, depois de um tempo, elas ficam previsíveis. Se minha base tá bem planejada, dá pra só sentar e assistir os zumbis sendo triturados. Mesmo assim, nada se compara àquela primeira horda que te pega despreparada – eu nunca vou esquecer a sensação de desespero.

Progressão: Boa, mas pode melhorar
Eu adoro o sistema de habilidades e perks do jogo. É muito bom poder moldar meu personagem de acordo com o meu estilo de jogo. Mas a verdade é que, depois de tantas horas, você acaba desbloqueando quase tudo e fica com a sensação de que não tem mais pra onde evoluir.

Multiplayer: Onde o jogo brilha
Se você quer saber onde o jogo realmente brilha, é no multiplayer. Jogar com os amigos é ouuuuutra experiência. Dividir as tarefas, construir uma base juntos e enfrentar hordas em equipe é muito divertido. Mas vou ser sinceraa: o matchmaking não ajuda muito, então se você não tem uma galera pra jogar, vai ser meio complicado.

Pontos Positivos
Gráficos e modelos de personagens bem melhores que em versões anteriores.
Ciclo de sobrevivência que prende e desafia, especialmente nos primeiros dias.
Sistema de construção criativo e flexível.
Biomas variados e exploração recompensadora.
Multiplayer divertido (priiiincipalmente com amigos).

Pontos Negativos
O jogo pode ficar repetitivo depois de muitas horas.
Desempenho ainda deixa a desejar em momentos mais intensos.
Layouts repetitivos nas construções.
Progressão que perde o impacto no final.

Vale a Pena?
Com certeza! Mesmo com suas limitações, 7 Days to Die é uma experiência única pra quem curte sobrevivência e sandbox. Se você gosta de criar, explorar e desafiar sua criatividade, esse é o jogo.

Minha nota? 8/10. Ele ainda pode melhorar em vários aspectos, mas, considerando o quanto eu já joguei, ele entrega uma experiência viciante e cheia de momentos épicos.

185773124.review:
well after playing it for a while, lemme put some things in a row for ppl reading.

first and foremost, this game been in development for over 10 years, the devs removed "exploits" but fail to polish the game properly until about alpha 20 ish. (wich was shortly before actual release)
now the game is 1.0 state but they still throw out about 20+ bug fixes monthly. this game is still in Beta version at best.
do not be fooled by the 1.X, its still a beta product at best.

for the conclusion, scroll down. lets start with pro's first

pro's: i do like that the game is not holding hands.
specialized traders
magazines are easy to find (with a few exceptions)
water should not be an issue if you get a couple quests done so you can buy dew collector parts (the cheap ones) and scrap/loot to make a dew collector or two.
weapons are pretty powerfull if you perk in them. just don't spread ur points too much.
friends make the game soooo much better.
decent amount of POI (points of interest) variation.
the right choices make for an insanely easy early game.
armor pieces/sets have busted bonuses if used correctly.
can shoot trough rails and bars and still keep them brain nommers away from you. (spitting cops not included)

cons: (oh boy)
zombie variation is Meh at best. some skin/outfit changes does not make it much better.
trigger rooms and hidden zombies. (talking about zombies hidden in walls, ceilings, wardrobes, vents etc. makes NO sense at all why they're there)
triggering entire rooms of zombies when shooting the supposed "silent" bows/crossbows
Screamer frequency is way too high. sometimes they scream and trigger nothing, sometimes they scream and trigger a dozen zombies. sometimes they see you from 50 meters away and sometimes you stand point blank range, face to face and nothing happens. they appear too much, too fast.
traders buying only 1/2 of a weapon? but sell like 3/4 of the same type?
specialized traders.... yeah if you want weapons or vehicle stuff... tough luck. good luck traveling half the map to find the guy who sells them. other traders MIGHT have some stuff. but its in low amounts as they aren't specialized in it.
biomes... just 5 biomes after 10 years? abrupt and clunky biome changes.
having to go trough a wasteland for 10 minutes to get to the burned forest early game cuz of your trade route quest is a death sentence...
i said i like how the game isn't holding hands. but no aim assist makes a 1 pixel miss with your aiming... a waste of a bullet.
the amount of times i've missed a headshot by a couple pixels is stupid. often it doesn't even register the hit either while you see the arrow go trough the zombies head.
Roadkills only work on small animals at low speeds. i've noticed that at higher speeds the game fails to register hitbox collision and the animals doesn't die.
vehicle dmg 5%+ for hitting a zombie? thought cars were made of iron/steel? how can a rotten zombie do so much dmg on it?
saw zombies trying to jump over the lines of the road and then faceplant the asphalt... (what the fuck?)
the ai is really, really bad in path finding and descision making. real shame for a 10 year development.


conclusion: play it with friends mostly. specialize in a few perks and have busted bonuses very early.
if you play alone, certain perks are must haves to make ur life easier.
the game is absolutely chunky and weird in many, many ways. for a 10 year development this is an absolute disaster. the devs spend more time removing exploits and features then optimizing the game.
BUT, regardless of the many bad things it got going, its still being updated. and it is a fun in between thing to play when ur bored. worth the price? very debatable. but you can easily get ur moneys worth out of the gameplay.

quick tip: just put bloodmoon hordes at 10 days to give urself some extra days fucking around, and turn zombies in walkers if you do not like the brutal default options/difficulties. makes for a much more enjoyable experience if you ask me. and less stressfull.

185746987.review:
Looking for a good zombie survival sim? Keep looking, this is not it.
I got this on a friends recommendation, worst $15 I've spent on steam (so far) and I've apparently played to long to get  refund. Don't let the trailer or the "positive" reviews fool you, this game is un-ironically bad.

To start, the game looks much worse graphically than the store trailer makes it seem, and yes I have cranked up the settings to max and I'm running it in 2k res. It still looks like a poor PS2 port like it did years and years ago.
Second, the survival aspects of the game are poorly conveyed to a new player and it can be very frustrating to learn. How to cook food properly, how to craft medical items, and other basics are not explained in a meaningful way in game thus going to the wiki or youtube is essential. There should be some kind of knowledge base explaining core concepts in game that players can reference, not just the "tooltips" on loading screens or the minimal "achievement" log.
Lastly, this game fails in its combat. Fighting zombies in this game is horrid at the early levels, I've been told it gets better later on but I doubt it. You level combat skills like an RPG, which is fine, but until you gain some levels you are walking toddler who can barely defend themselves. Hit boxes are wonky, early weapons are borderline useless, and head-shots feel lackluster; they do extra damage but don't instantly kill... Lame.

Ich habe schon ein paar Stunden in diesem Spiel verbracht und möchte jetzt auch mal meine Meinung abgeben.

An sich ein sehr gutes, umfangreiches Spiel. Meiner Meinung nach gibt es am Content nichts zu meckern. Die Gebäude sehen toll aus und haben alle ihren gewissen Reiz. Immer wieder wird man überrascht und kommt auch Richtung Ende noch in kritische Situationen. Sehr intensives Gameplay, und gerade mit den Zombies, die einen immer wieder mal aus dem Nichts treffen, bleibt es immer spannend.

Etwas, was mir nicht gefällt, ist die Performance. Mein alter Computer mag das Spiel oftmals nicht so sehr. Andere Spiele sind so programmiert, dass sie immer noch einwandfrei laufen, obwohl sie ähnlich anspruchsvollen Content haben.

Etwas Weiteres ist, dass die Entwickler immer wieder mal geliebte Funktionen entfernen, wie zum Beispiel die Möglichkeit, Gläser an einem See aufzufüllen und dann am Lagerfeuer abzukochen. Oder, dass man nach dem Trinken eine leere Glasflasche zurückbekommt. Das gleiche gilt für das Essen aus der Dose. Man konnte entspannt sein Katzenfutter snacken und danach die Dose zu Metall verarbeiten oder einfach so einschmelzen.

Jetzt haben sie schon wieder etwas entfernt, was total cool war – den ganzen Rüstungs-, Klamotten- etc. Spaß. Es wurden so viele tolle Möglichkeiten genommen, sich zu stylen. Da haben meine Freunde und ich schon ein paar tolle Lacher gehabt, und jetzt ist es weg...

Alles in allem ein super Survival-Spiel. Ich und viele andere nennen es das 'Minecraft für Erwachsene', und jeder weiß, dass Minecraft legendär ist.

185703889.review:
7 Days To Die: Зомби, выживание и крафт в постапокалиптическом мире

7 Days To Die — это игра, которая сочетает в себе элементы выживания, хоррора и симулятора. Выпущенная в 2013 году, она до сих пор привлекает внимание игроков благодаря своей уникальной механике и атмосфере.

Достоинства:        

Графика и атмосфера. Несмотря на то, что игра вышла более одиннадцати лет назад, (И недавно вышла в релиз) её визуальная составляющая впечатляет. Даже на низких настройках графика выглядит достойно, а после обновлений и улучшений стала ещё лучше. Атмосфера постапокалиптического мира, наполненного зомби, создаёт ощущение реальности и погружает в игру с головой.

Реалистичность и динамика. Зомби в 7 Days To Die ведут себя как настоящие хищники. С наступлением ночи они становятся агрессивнее, быстрее и выносливее. Это не просто противники, а полноценные враги, которые заставляют игрока быть начеку и разрабатывать стратегию выживания.

Продавцы и задания. В игре есть торговцы, которые не только продают предметы, но и дают задания. Каждое новое задание становится всё сложнее и интереснее, а награда за их выполнение позволяет улучшить своё снаряжение и базу. И опыта много выдают

Крафт и строительство. 7 Days To Die предоставляет игрокам широкие возможности для крафта и строительства. Вы можете создавать оружие, броню, инструменты и многое другое, что поможет вам выжить в мире, полном опасностей. Строительство базы также играет важную роль, ведь это ваш дом и убежище от зомби.

Мультиплеер. Игра поддерживает мультиплеер, что позволяет играть с друзьями или другими игроками со всего мира. Совместное выживание становится ещё более увлекательным и напряжённым, ведь вам придётся помогать друг другу и защищать свои базы от зомби.

Недостатки:

Оптимизация. Несмотря на все достоинства, игра всё ещё страдает от проблем с оптимизацией. Это может вызывать проблемы с производительностью на некоторых компьютерах, особенно на старых моделях.

Сложность. 7 Days To Die может показаться сложной для новичков. Игрокам потребуется время, чтобы разобраться в механике игры и понять, как лучше всего выживать. Однако, после нескольких часов игры, вы начнёте чувствовать себя более уверенно и сможете наслаждаться процессом.

185642015.review:
Disappointingly Unfinished and Tedious
I am absolutely shocked at the fact that they updated  the graphics, changed and tweaked some small things, and thought that it's what would make the game be ready for release.
They were very wrong.

I really wanted to love 7 Days to Die. On paper, it sounds perfect for someone like myself, a big survival and zombie game fan: a survival game with crafting, base-building, and zombie hordes to fend off. But after spending a good chunk of time with it, I can't help but feel let down.

The concept is solid, and when everything clicks—like when you’re working with friends to fend off a massive horde—it can be genuinely fun. The destructible environments and the freedom to build and strategize are cool ideas that set it apart from other survival games, but seeing some changes they made? it was nearly not enough to keep playing the game for me after I finished all the achievements.

Graphics and Performance got improved! but it still lags like hell and frame drops happen way too often, ESPECIALLY during the blood moon.
Still Feels Unfinished, even after all these years in early access.
I expected more polish. Instead, it feels like a work-in-progress with bugs and rough edges everywhere. Sometimes the glitches are funny, but other times they ruin the experience, and I am still salty they slapped on a graphical update and called it a day.

The first few hours are fun, but after a while, it becomes clear that the game play loop doesn’t evolve much. You’re scavenging, building, and waiting for the next horde. It’s fun at first, but it gets old fast when there is absolutely nothing else to do.
Fighting zombies just doesn’t feel great. Melee is clunky, ranged weapons aren’t much better, and the zombies themselves aren’t all that smart. They’re more annoying than threatening most of the time.
On top of it, there are a ton of things to craft, but the system feels like a grind fest. Gathering resources and leveling up skills takes so long that it starts feeling like busywork instead of rewarding progression, they remade some things regarding the skills and leveling up, but in my opinion it feels even more like a chore now.
For a game about surviving a zombie apocalypse, it’s surprisingly not very scary or immersive. The world feels empty, and while the sound design seems to have gotten better? it still bugs out so much and doesn’t do much to build tension, rather I find myself cackling that I can still hear the zombie after I bashed their head in, or the fact that I heard the zombie even though they were far away.

Things they changed that I absolutely hated were - the skill advancement system, the new skill system eliminates the RNG of finding schematics, but it’s less rewarding. Finding books now feels mundane, as I had tons of those unused books, and managing skills in co-op takes up excessive inventory space.
The skill tree - Despite updates, the skill tree remains unbalanced. Some perks are must-picks while others are consistently useless, making play style variety feel limited even post-release.
THE WATER SOURCES (Just why) - no more glasses for us! why? because it got too easy, so why not make glasses harder to make instead? nah, too much work... let's just remove them altogether!
and the trader quests... before an option, now you must do those to get exp and money,  and you'd be focusing less on exploration which is what I personally enjoyed the most.

7 Days to Die has some great ideas, but it’s hard to recommend in its current state. If you’re really into survival games and don’t mind dealing with a lot of frustration, you might find something to enjoy here. But for most people, it’s just not worth the time. I hope they can fix these issues someday because the potential is definitely there, though I lost hope in that game ever getting better.

Another zombie game to the trash pile.
4\10 "Make it snappy, I gotta take a crap"

185585030.review:
Seven Days to Die is hands down one of the most engaging survival games I’ve ever played. Over the years, I’ve been thoroughly impressed by the immense progress the developers have made. The game continues to evolve in exciting ways, offering a unique mix of survival, base-building, and zombie-slaying that’s perfect for anyone who loves Minecraft-style creativity with an adult twist.

What Makes It Awesome?
The depth of game play is outstanding. Whether scavenging for resources, crafting intricate bases, or battling waves of the undead, Seven Days to Die offers a thrilling and immersive experience. The balance of survival mechanics and creative building keeps you hooked for hours. It’s a game that rewards both strategic planning and adaptability, making every in-game day feel like a new adventure.

The customization options, world-building potential, and relentless survival challenges make it a standout in the genre. The atmosphere is tense and immersive, yet offers enough freedom to cater to different playstyles—whether you’re a lone survivor or prefer teaming up with friends.

Opportunities for Improvement:
While the game is incredible, I believe the multiplayer aspect could benefit from a more modern approach. A major improvement would be the addition of dedicated servers, similar to what Rust offers. It would be a game-changer to have servers where players can log in and play at any time, even if the original host isn’t online. This level of persistence in multiplayer would elevate the community and enhance long-term engagement.

Another area for potential growth is the game’s visual polish. While the graphics have improved significantly over time, a cleaner, more refined environment would go a long way in adding to the game’s immersion.

Final Thoughts
Despite these areas for improvement, Seven Days to Die remains a phenomenal experience. I highly recommend it to anyone who loves survival games, base-building, or adult-level creativity. The game is a shining example of how to blend survival, strategy, and fun into one package. Here’s hoping for many more expansions and updates in the future!

If you haven’t tried Seven Days to Die yet, you’re missing out.

185573712.review:
„7 Days to Die“ ist ein faszinierendes Überlebensspiel, das eine gelungene Mischung aus Sandbox, Horror und Tower-Defense bietet. Die offene Welt, die ständig von Zombies und anderen Gefahren bedroht wird, lädt zu unzähligen Stunden des Entdeckens und Kämpfens ein. Besonders hervorzuheben ist die Spielmechanik, bei der es nicht nur ums Überleben geht, sondern auch ums Craften, Bauen und Verbessern.

Die düstere Atmosphäre, kombiniert mit der realistischen Tag- und Nachtzyklus, schafft eine fesselnde Spannung. In der Nacht wird das Spiel zu einer echten Herausforderung, wenn Horden von Untoten die Basis angreifen. Doch auch die Tage sind alles andere als sicher – das Sammeln von Ressourcen, der Ausbau der Basis und das Überstehen von zufälligen Ereignissen sorgen für ständige Aufregung und Belohnungen.

Die Möglichkeit, alleine oder im Koop-Modus mit Freunden zu spielen, macht „7 Days to Die“ noch abwechslungsreicher und intensiver. Trotz einiger technischer Schwächen in Bezug auf Performance und Bugs, ist das Spiel insgesamt eine großartige Wahl für Fans von Survival- und Open-World-Spielen.

Fazit: „7 Days to Die“ bietet eine tiefgehende und spannende Erfahrung für alle, die eine Herausforderung suchen und nicht davor zurückschrecken, in einer gefährlichen, post-apokalyptischen Welt zu überleben. Ein Muss für Survival-Fans!

185572389.review: Интересная выживалка, много крафта, интересные биомы, их всего пять. Интересная задумка о том, что можно уничтожить всё, что ты видишь перед собой. Но игра на разок. Если досконально проходить все миссии у торговцев и основательно развиваться на каждом биоме по очередно, то игры хватит на часов 200. Я наиграл свои 100 с копеечной часов, не пройдя последнюю локацию пустошь, не дошел до нее, подустал от того, что я на предпоследнем биоме был фулл развит по инвентарю, оружию и технике, и понимал, что нового ничего не будет на следующей локации. Навыки далеко не все развить успел. Кровавые ночи после 21-27 дня уже не отличаются никакой сложностью, через следующие 7 дней волна не будет опасней или сложней. Хотелось, чтобы больше техники добавили, и да чтобы починили звук выхлопа джипа. Звук там ужас, лучше б вообще не делали его.

185540782.review:
7 Days to Die is a great game, but any recommendation I could give it is inherently a bit double-edged because I genuinely think it was a better game last year. Just about everything I like about its foundation is still there; it's a survival crafting game that manages to be fully voxel-based and destructible without looking the part, with an emphasis less on exploring randomly generated terrain and more on exploring structures that are randomly placed but hand-made, with each one feeling like a fun mini-dungeon hiding its own little surprises. There's plenty of content, plenty to build, and it lasts a long time before getting old. I spent a long time playing it via gamepass before coming back to put 50 more hours into it with my usual group for 1.0, and we had a good time doing it. But by the end of it, we all had our own complaints as well. The problem with the 1.0 changes aren't that they ruined the game, so much as that they change it ever so slightly into a different type of game than the one we came to it for; it's like right at the end of development someone on the team played an ARPG and had an epiphany. 

Most of the changes feel like they were made for people who have been playing the game for thousands of hours and just want to grind efficiently, rather than new players just wanting to explore and play the game with fresh eyes. A minor example of this is the trader system; in the previous versions, any of the game's different vendors could show up anywhere, and it was possible to get lucky and find towns with two different ones in the area. In 1.0 we eventually moved into a town that had three traders, which was pretty exciting until I realized they were all Trader Hugh (sorry, Hugh) because of them being made biome-specific. You can obviously guess why they did this. For people who already know the game and just want to get going, it takes a lot of the guess work out of finding a trader of a certain type they might need to start optimally instead of having to wander for ages looking for one with a bit of bad luck. But for normal people, those sorts of experiences are practically a cornerstone of the genre; survival crafting games are all about generating funny stories caused by the randomness, and I feel like probably everyone that's ever played one has at least one memory of searching for ages for something and how good it felt when they finally stumbled across it or finding something they didn't even know was in the game after finishing it multiple times. Yeah, it can be frustrating in the moment, but that's why it's called "survival" crafting, not vacation crafting. Get real, man.

The last time I played this game, there was a clothing system that, while not necessarily robust, had a nice amount of variety, as well as minor gameplay elements. You could loot funny hats and put together outfits, customize your character's looks without worrying about stats, and dress for the weather. This has all been replaced with various sets of armor and a promise of re-adding it about a year later. You can still mix and match pieces of armor, and in some ways it can even be preferable with their individual effects, but each set also has a set bonus that encourages you to just wear a full set instead of dressing up the way you want to. Some of the funny items like cigars are still in the game, but only as accessories you equip to your gear with no visual change. And that's adequate -- at least there are still options, and while I wish there were more armor sets they at least look pretty unique -- but it just feels arbitrary, even mechanically. If you went into a snow biome from the start before, your character would end up freezing pretty quickly if you didn't have warm clothes to layer up with, and my first memory of such a thing was spending a night huddled by a campfire in a house surrounded by bears. Which is fun! I love having moments like those in these games. I went there in 1.0 fairly early on expecting to relive the memory, and found that because I had crafted basically any armor set at all I was already above the threshold of the weather doing anything more than a very minor stamina debuff. Why even bother?

But the thing that pisses me off the most is that despite its stat focus, the last time I played the game it did a good job of keeping the progression separate from the gameplay, so that you could comfortably specialize no matter what you chose to do as long as you were killing zombies and generally doing something. There were books you could find that gave unique and fun bonus traits, which are still there, but for the most part you were free to do whatever you wanted without feeling like you were lagging behind anyone you were playing with. In the current build, the entire system has been changed so that nothing really matters except the magazines you've read. Want to make better guns? Read 100 handgun magazines. Want to make better clothes? Without reading 100 issues of Fashion Weekly? C'mon, let's be serious! Nearly every crafting skill in the game now has 100 arbitrary points you have to raise by reading that many magazines (yes, yes, give or take 20 or so if you wear the nerd outfit, sue me geeksquad), and it's as tiring as you'd expect. Unless, of course, you do quests -- which are now basically the only viable way to progress even remotely smoothly, because of how often they reward you with loot boxes full of an assortment of magazines that are usually guided to what you're trying to level. And this, hundreds of words later, is my core problem with the new update. It doesn't matter if you want to loot, if you want to farm, if you just want to kill zombies; if you're not doing quests, you will burn out of the game long before you finish any crafting tree, to the point that it feels actively detrimental to just go out and explore on your own. Even the vendors themselves have been heavily nerfed to the point that most of their inventory is completely arbitrary in favor of the things you can craft at a given time, with their only lingering purpose being selling junk and occasionally buying things you're just too lazy to go find. Which would be fine, if the trader didn't still constantly get hung up on sending you to the same three or four buildings per quest tier or try to send you to Tilted Towers 6,000 meters away if your towns don't generate just right.

I'm sure some poindexter with 10,000 hours in the game is going to come into my comments like "erm, ackshually, the changes added a sense of balance that was greatly desired for the pvp experience", to which I say come at me because I am simply morally superior and way cooler. And despite my complaints, I do still maintain that it is still fun. But the reason behind my great american novel is to give context for the bottom line: is it worth $45? No. I mean, I don't even have to think about it, honestly. When I bought it the game was $25, and I thought that was a fair price then and it's still a fair price now. $45 is frankly a crack pipe price for it in its current state, especially given that it rocketed up that $20 with no meaningful changes from the previous build. But they have a lengthy roadmap listing out things that should have been in anything called "1.0", like bringing back the wardrobe system, adding in bandits, and even story content and new quests, which all sound like excellent ideas. If those end up coming to pass and don't get stripped down after 10 more years of rebalancing then I think the current price tag would be more justified. For now, just wait for a sale and don't be afraid to look into a few mods.

185490186.review:
Нормальная песочница с открытым миром и большой свободой действий. Плюсы каждый найдёт для себя сам, конкретно минусы: 
1)Долго. Долго едешь к торговцу, долго едешь с задания на задание, долго едешь от одного торговца к другому, слишком большое расстояние между локациями. Почему велосипед едет так будто на нём едет не мужик или женщина а первоклассник? К слову велосипед долго добывается. Мне кажется новый игрок может задолбаться раньше чем его получит, как и дробаш или автомат. За  100 часов, 50 я ждал пока всё переплавиться, пока наступит день, пока откроется торговец, пока доеду, или не дай бог дойду, до локации. 
А ещё же есть стамина... Жажда которую на начальных этапах игры вообще непонятно чем восполнять, она просто быстро уходит. Силы у персонажа заканчиваются так будто он до этого курил 20 лет по пачке в день. Пробежал сто метров? Отдохни... А до локации всё ещё полтора километра.
.
2)Разнообразие. Тупо мало зомби и мутантов, хочется больше разнообразия и крафтов из добычи которая могла бы падать.
.
3)Сюжет. Лор. нету ни лора, ни сюжета. Откуда пришли торговцы? Как они докатились до жизни такой? Что я здесь делаю? Какова моя цель? С кем торгуют торговцы если я один на сервере? 
.
Итого: Игра часов на 10-20 так то. Позависать с друзьями можно. В принципе прикольно, но ещё раз туда врятли вернёшься. Может быть разок в месяц провести 7 дней гоняясь по квестам торговца. Сам наиграл 100 часов, но не советую. Есть игры интересней.

185468412.review:
I mean it's almost sickening that I have to sit here and write this review to try and articulate how horrendous this game is. However for the greater good I have to try and convey the absolute horror show of a game this is to the masses, so they are not deceived by the endless piles of bs from people that enjoy worse than subpar gameplay from fully released garbage fests.

If you somehow buy this game for $45 dollars, then the chances are you are extremely stupid and possibly special needs, then you are in for a wild ride of disappointment. The game has been in development for over 10 years, and over those 10 years it is hard to see where the improvements were made. The game feels disgustingly clunky and it's made in a way where it's like some disgusting take on minecraft style building but in real life. The AI of the zombies is atrocious, they hit you from across the screen when you can't even reach them, and the game is an absolute slog fest. Run around an endless wasteland with nothing to do while gathering scraps of loot that are essentially pointless. Then once you do all of that you can set up a sh*t shack and wait until zombies come to destroy it like a heard of elephants. If you somehow endure the nasty gameplay until the point where you fortify your base like fort knox then I am so sorry you had to go through that miserable time. Game is complete clunk fest with 0 content. The fact they are selling this game for $45 is unbelievable and I think someone needs to take a step back and review what they are putting on the market. $10 game on it's best day. 

-10/10. NEVER PLAY THIS HORRENDOUS GAME

185435435.review:
The game is very fun, especially with friends. I do wish that the hoard nights would get progressively more diversified as you move on through the game, but it just adds 1-2 extra zombies every 10 nights or so. They increase in size, but it gets a bit repetetive after a while.

It's also unfortunate to see that there's not any formiddable story for this game. You start the game, you spawn in and you just spawn in somewhere random without context.

Some game elements, such as the UI (which is not all that important) is quite outdated by modern standards. 

And also the fact that this game goes for 42 bucks after getting an "official" release, which, by the way, involved just a handful of updates. Getting the game out of the Alpha stage, I would expect them to at least do a major update to appeal to players, not just make some minor adjustments and changes that won't really add a major touch to the game.

Nevertheless, it's a very fun game to play. Is it worth 42 bucks? Absolutely not! Wait when it's on a sale and then get it.

185385915.review:
Alright, folks, let me tell you about this game, 7 Days to Die. It's a tremendous game, believe me. One of the best. People are saying it's the best survival game out there, and I have to agree. It's got everything—crafting, building, zombies. You name it, it's got it.

The graphics? Incredible. The gameplay? Unbelievable. You won't believe how immersive it is. You can build your own fortress, defend it from hordes of zombies, and let me tell you, nobody builds better fortresses than me. It's a game that really makes you think, makes you strategize.

And the multiplayer? Fantastic. You can team up with friends, or go it alone. Either way, you're going to have a great time. It's a game that brings people together, just like I do.

So, if you haven't played 7 Days to Die yet, you're missing out. Bigly. Go get it, and start surviving. You'll thank me later.

Tremendous game, folks. Tremendous.

Есть некая прогрессия,что заставляет играть все дальше и дальше. В какой то момент ты уже прокачал все навыки,построил базу и приходит орда которая сносит твою кабину и ты останешься жить в кибитке 2х2.

185360226.review:
Игра сама по себе действительно уникальная. Но как человек, который играл в неё ещё в 14-й альфе скажу. 
1. Крафт убили. Сейчас тебе нужно находить не схемы крафта и не прокачивать уровень, открывая верстаки и прочее. Сейчас тебе нужно лутать 100500 журналов, чтобы ты мог продвинуться дальше в дереве прогресса. 
2. Почти нереально найти автоматы и винтовки в начале игры, как было раньше. Разработчики подумали что это имба и теперь все вынуждены крафтить трубное оружие, подозрительного качества. 
Но почему имба? Не понятно. В любом случае оружию нужны патроны, рем комплекты и тд. 
3. Зомби, как и локации заранее сделаны разработчиком и выглядит это как коридорный хоррор, нежели открытая песочница. 
Везде заметны руки разрабов, начиная от того, что игра сама подстраивается под то, что тебе должно выпадать в луте. 
До альфы 21 игра была в разы лучше. Сейчас играть одному в принципе нереально. Так как чтобы построить дом, скрафтить оружие к 7 ночи, поставить ферму, изучить аптеку, научиться готовить, нужно оооочень много журналов. Что в принципе усложняет весь процесс геймплея и ВЫНУЖДАЕТ игрока заниматься тем, чем он не хочет!

沒玩過七日殺別說你是個建築達人⋯⋯
如果你是，那我強烈建議你試試造個麥塊史詩版的世界奇觀（笑），但不同的是，七日殺的牛頓是在線的XD，要是承重不夠會瞬間坍塌給你看。

殭屍跟野獸方面種類覺得還可以再豐富點，比如水裡的食人魚或鯊魚，沙漠的毒蠍，森林的蜘蛛，城市下水道的老鼠，不然殭屍很容易看膩XD。

水的方面覺得可以再優化，一桶水倒下去的水量實在很有違和感，但總體來說是好的，水裡實在很荒蕪可以美化些，光禿禿的很醜，期待更新。

[i] El Apocalipsis es el último libro del Nuevo Testamento y, como tal, de la Biblia. También es conocido como Revelación de Jesucristo por el título que al principio se da a este libro ​ y, en algunos círculos protestantes, simplemente como Revelación o Libro de las Revelaciones. [/i]

En general, un juego apocalíptico donde puedes romperlo todo y construir tu base y verla reventar por los aires "cada 7 Lunas de sangre"... o no.

185235578.review: After many years of playing this game, seeing the community rise and fall on many updates, this game has nonetheless never stopped impressing what a jump scare horror survival should feel like. Its a plain classic feel. However, with the recent update, recent release, and such; there as many games do, have a toxic player base, some worst than others. This game as any other also has its fair share of people who can and will cheat to ruin the gameplay of others and one such server within the community that exists and the owner may be a nice person but he houses and protects people who cheat. This server is called NAPVP. The owner of the server is Grandpa Minion. The server has many mods that make the experience thrilling but the player base is what makes the gameplay not so fun. Many people use wall hacks, damage mitigation hacks, etc. While i recommend this game and cannot give it a 10/10 perfect rating, i will say this game when and if you find the right server or rent your own for that matter is a thrilling and creepy experience. I do say avoid NAPVP if you value your sanity and love for this game.

10/10 - Cool Game, Great Concept.
The more I play this game, the more I appreciate it. It exudes passion. The variety of buildings to loot and explore are not only vast, but also multilayered and filled with events. I love walking through a house and seeing a zombie plummet from the ceiling in front of me because that's what the devs programmed. The humor is a wonderful touch too. You can feel the silly personalities of the developers in every aspect of this game. I primarily use fists, and listening to what sounds like 40 buckets of gore being splattered every time I give a zrambo a nice knuckle sandwich NEVER gets old. My one complaint is that trader Jen is a lame excuse for a "sexy" character, whose voice actor only serves to make you feel mild discomfort.

185182771.review:
7 Days to Die – Ein Survival-Meisterwerk, das die Zeit zum Feind macht

Ein Spiel, das dich stundenlang fesselt, mit jedem Überlebensversuch neue Herausforderungen bietet und dich immer wieder zurückkehren lässt.

Überleben ist die einzige Option

„7 Days to Die“ ist ein echtes Überlebensspiel, das einen gewaltigen Zeitaufwand fordert, um in einer post-apokalyptischen Welt zu überleben. Der Fokus liegt auf Überlebensstrategien, Ressourcenmanagement und der Bekämpfung von Untoten, die in Wellen auf den Spieler zukommen. Doch es ist nicht nur das ständige Überleben, das das Spiel so fesselnd macht, sondern die unzähligen Möglichkeiten, mit denen du deine Welt gestalten kannst. Es ist ein Spiel, das dich zwingt, ständig neue Wege zu finden, um zu überleben, sei es durch das Erforschen der Welt, das Sammeln von Ressourcen oder das Basteln von Waffen.

Mit mehr als 300 Stunden auf der Uhr kannst du immer noch neue Dinge entdecken und Herausforderungen angehen. Wenn du dich mit Freunden zusammenschließt, wird das Ganze noch spannender, da die Dynamik und das gegenseitige Überleben als Gruppe noch mehr Tiefe und Spaß bieten. Neue Waffen und Perks zu testen oder sich gegen die Zombies zu verteidigen, ist immer wieder aufregend und sorgt für frischen Wind.

Ein gigantisches Spiel mit einer riesigen Welt

Die Welt von „7 Days to Die“ ist riesig, und jedes Mal, wenn du sie betrittst, gibt es neue Orte zu erkunden, neue Geheimnisse zu entdecken und neue Feinde zu bekämpfen. Der ständige Fortschritt, der in jedem Durchgang erreicht wird, motiviert, noch länger zu spielen. Selbst wenn du denkst, dass du alles gesehen hast, kann die Welt dank der Zufallsgenerierung nie wirklich gleich sein, was das Spiel sehr wiederholungswertig macht.

Die vielen Optionen beim Crafting und die Möglichkeit, deine Ausrüstung auf vielfältige Weise zu verbessern, ist ein weiterer Grund, warum „7 Days to Die“ so ein herausragendes Survival-Erlebnis bietet. Du kannst Schusswaffen herstellen, Fallen bauen, Mauern errichten und deinen eigenen Unterschlupf so gestalten, wie du es für nötig hältst, um der Zombie-Horde zu trotzen. Alles, was du baust, ist ein Zeugnis deines Fortschritts und deiner Kreativität.

Ein loot-orientiertes Paradies für Entdecker und Sammelwütige

„Lootgoblins“ – für die Sammler unter uns ist „7 Days to Die“ das Paradies. Das ständige Suchen nach Ressourcen und Ausrüstungsgegenständen bringt eine gewisse Suchtgefahr mit sich. Bei jedem Durchgang gibt es immer neue Raritäten und Waffen, die du finden kannst. Wer die Herausforderung liebt, sich immer besser auszustatten und neue Loot-Inhalte zu entdecken, wird hier stundenlang festsitzen.

Das Spiel bietet eine einzigartige Kombination aus Kampf, Überleben und Ressourcenmanagement. Und auch wenn es dir gelingt, eine Weile zu überleben, ist das Ziel stets klar: Du musst dich immer wieder neu anpassen, deine Strategie ändern und dich weiterentwickeln, um mit den steigenden Bedrohungen zurechtzukommen.

Langzeitspaß ohne Ende

„7 Days to Die“ ist ein Spiel, das einen im besten Sinne fesselt und fordert. Die Komplexität und Vielfalt, die das Spiel bietet, ermöglichen es, immer neue Wege zu finden, das Spiel zu erleben. Ob du alleine spielst oder in einer festen Gruppe von Freunden – es bleibt immer spannend, und das Gefühl, wieder etwas Neues zu schaffen oder zu entdecken, ist nie weit entfernt.

Für Liebhaber des Survival-Genres und für all jene, die nie genug vom Sammeln, Basteln und Kämpfen bekommen können, ist „7 Days to Die“ ein absoluter Klassiker, der sich nicht nur aufgrund seiner epischen Spielzeit und ständigen Neuerungen als ein Meisterwerk etabliert hat. Die Mischung aus Horror, Abenteuer, Rollenspiel und Tower Defense macht es zu einem einmaligen Erlebnis, das immer wieder gespielt werden kann.

Fazit: Ein unaufhörlicher Überlebenskampf

„7 Days to Die“ bietet nicht nur eine der besten Zombie-Survival-Erfahrungen, sondern auch ein absolut süchtig machendes Gameplay. Die endlose Freiheit, die Welt zu gestalten, die ständigen Herausforderungen durch Zombies und die Fülle an Loot machen das Spiel zu einem der besten Survival-Titel. Wer auf eine spannende Mischung aus Überleben, Erkunden und Bauen steht, wird in „7 Days to Die“ sein Paradies finden. Und wer weiß, wie viele weitere Stunden noch folgen – hier könnte das Ende wirklich nie kommen.

185181948.review:
I have played quite a few hours by now and i quite like the game.
Though it has weaknesses it, it is still a work in progress and it has been given quite a few updates since I first started playing it.
To put it short, this is like minecraft, an open world zombie survival builder. You start with nothing at all and slowly (sometimes a bit too slowly) build up tools, weapons, armor and a home to defend from the pesky undead who roam the land.
You can earn and spend a lot of talent points to facilitaed the playstyle you prefer and will get awsome perks from it, allowing you to craft better items, find them instead in the open world or grow and harvest crops to combat the ever creeping hunger.
Play alone or with friends or stangers and tune the difficulty to your liking from relativly relaxed to bullet-sweating hardcore. And you can find a pultitude of mods out there to cusomize the game even further and make it your own.
Build a stronghold and wait for the blood moon, where hordes of zombies will activly search for you for one night.
Are you prepared?

185169214.review:
7 Days to Die, developed by The Fun Pimps, is a multifaceted survival horror game that intricately blends crafting, exploration, and base-building with the tension of a post-apocalyptic zombie world. Released in its initial alpha stage in 2013, the game continues to evolve, showcasing a dedication to player engagement and innovation within the sandbox survival genre.

Set in a procedurally generated open world, the game tasks players with surviving against relentless hordes of zombies, culminating in the infamous "Blood Moon" event every seven days. This cyclical challenge serves as a compelling narrative and gameplay driver, creating a constant tension between preparation and execution. The dynamic weather system and day-night cycle further enhance the atmosphere, adding a layer of realism to the desolate, haunting landscapes.

The gameplay mechanics are impressively intricate. The crafting and progression systems are robust, allowing players to scavenge resources, forge tools, and build everything from rudimentary shelters to elaborate fortresses. The inclusion of a skill tree and perk system offers meaningful customization, catering to diverse playstyles, whether focused on combat, construction, or exploration. Survival elements such as managing hunger, thirst, and stamina add to the complexity, making every decision feel significant.

Multiplayer stands out as one of the game’s strongest aspects, fostering both cooperation and competition. Players can team up to fortify their defenses or test their mettle in PvP encounters. While some graphical elements and animations feel dated, the immersive environmental storytelling and strategic depth of gameplay far outweigh these shortcomings.

7 Days to Die is a game that rewards patience and ingenuity, offering a richly layered experience for fans of survival and horror. Despite its imperfections, it remains a testament to the enduring appeal of emergent gameplay and player-driven storytelling.

I used to play this every night to keep in touch with my siblings who lived further away than comfortable for visits. Together, we made a rundown house into a fortress that none could breach, and we worked tirelessly to maintain it. We operated like a group that knew our teamwork was what made us survive. 

Since the water collection changes, we haven't been able to enjoy the game anymore. The devs really decided to create problems s they could "fix" them and say "hey we finished the game finally". Do not waste your money on this. All that used to marginally make sense is gone, and all that is left is a grindy unforgiving experience that uses no sound logic to make you feel like you achieved anything. 

Congrats Devs. You really "finished" this one.

185130289.review:
A little over 2 hours into the game (around 4 in-game days), a massive group of zombies spawned around our base and fucked us up, and then proceed to fuck our dinky little cabin up (which took an hour to build).

Got a bunch of iron early on? Too bad, you need to go raid hundreds of houses to try and find enough "xp books" to level up your "harvesting tools" skill. You're stuck with shit stone tools until then.

Combat is really bad. Hitboxes are terrible. Zombies don't move predictably.

Hunger and thirst are really bad. You can't live without feasting like a king every 30 in-game minutes? You can't find any decent food early on, so you resort to hunting. Oh, what's that? You need *5 meat* to make 1 "charred" meat, which barely puts a dent in your hunger, when the average deer will give you 10-20 meat? The worst part of it all is you get a massive debuff to stamina regen and capacity if you don't gorge yourself on food 3 times an in-game day.

The UI actually sucks balls. You need a bachelor's degree to begin understanding the bullshit UI designs.

All in all - this game is not worth the price tag. I wouldn't even buy it for $5.

I was lucky to experience both the premature Xbox version back in 2018, and the latest current version here on PC. Overall, the game is definitely loads of fun. Building a whole base from scratch to protect yourself from danger, defending what you built with your life, exploring and trying to make survival viable and stable.. love it. One big downside for me is that the game is just ugly. One might argue that you can't turn an entirely modifiable map with infrastructures into an aesthetic wonder, and they might be right, but I really like my games to be visually pleasing. The scenery, the characters, the crafting are not pleasant to look at right now. I also like "realism" which is hardly doable with crafting games of this type.
The game might be a treasure for who will get past these issues. you might become totally addicted, it's just not for me anymore.

I know people maybe be thinking oh maybe he didnt pause, maybe zombies got it.. no you see my base took no damage, I was inside my base. It was paused. For sure. It just simply bugged out. 185005419.review:
[h1] Строительство, стрельба и разлетающиеся части зомби - красота! [Актуален для версии v1.2] [/h1]
 
Данная игра является идейным братом с Rust, да и вышли они в одно и тоже время.
Только RUST отбросил зомби и получал обновления, а эта игра долго была в альфе.
Что же сейчас я могу сказать об игре:

[h3] Плюсы [/h3] 

[u] Строительство [/u] 
Один из лучших аспектов этой игры. Ты можешь модифицировать ландшафт под себя, но ты также будешь ограничен физикой. То-есть построить огромный дом с одной балкой опоры в небесах - не выйдет. Дополнительно, в твоём арсенале есть множество ловушек, которые делают оборону твоего дома ещё более увлекательным.

[u] Кровавая луна [/u] 
Тот самый 7-й день, ради которого ты играешь предыдущие 6. Это как воскресенье в шестидневку. Это тот момент, когда ты пожинаешь плоды своего труда, будь то укреплённый дом, грамотно раставленные ловушки или изученные пушки.

[u] Огромное количество домов с интересными сценариями [/u] 
Каждый дом здесь как маленькое подземелье, в котором тебя ждут стычки с неписями и последующая награда, зависящая от уровня сложности. Неожиданные падение зомби с потолков, проснувшаяся толпа в каком-нибудь торговом зале - вызывают у тебя интерес к исследованию.

[u] Совместное выживание с друзьями [/u]
Тот самый момент, когда вы вместе идёте на задание по зачистке или когда вместе отбиваете кровавую орду - всё это приносит непередаваемые ощущения. 

[u] Музыкальное сопровождение [/u]
Очень мало выживалок сейчас имеют приятное музыкальное сопровождение. Но тут даже музыка в меню звучит очень атмосферно, что уж говорить об внутриигровых. 

[h3] Минусы [/h3]

[u] Unity [/u]
Мне не хватит слов чтобы описать - как же я ненавижу Unity. Тут же он проявляет себя самым типичным образом. Появилась толпа зомби? - лови просадку до 20 кадров при твоих 110 изначальных, и так до того момента пока всех не убьёшь. Потому ты опасаешься больших зданий, но не из-за опасностей, таящихся в них, а из-за страха детонации твоего персонального компуктера. 
 
[u] Проблема прогрессии развития [/u]
Прогрессия развития здесь примерно на дней 35-40. Получив все изучения, ты задашь себе один вопрос - что мне делать все эти 6 дней до наступления 7-го? Также сложность "Безумие" будет давать тебе испытания только в первые 7 дней, до появления тир 3 пушки или дубинки. 

[u] Кривое оружие и транспорт [/u]
Оружие и транспорт тут сделаны максимально топорно. Только с модом, сделанным ОДНИМ!!! человеком, мы получаем нормальную баллистику оружия, но не исправляем кривые звуки и смешную отдачу. С транспортом ситуация ещё забавнее. Как вам огромный джип, что не может сбить и ломается об деревянный забор? Также само ощущение транспорта оставляет желать лучшего.

[u] Однообразие неписей [/u]
Несмотря на интересную механику кровавой луны, отбивая очередную атаку, ты осознаешь, что перестал чувствовать их угрозу, для тебя они - "бесплатный опыт", а дело всё в их однообразии. Самым страшным из всех станет шахид и только потому, что он может нанести урон зданию и поцарапать твоё творение. 

[h1] Итог [/h1]

Если вы брали когда-то эту игру по цене пачки чипсов, то советую попробовать поиграть с друзьями. На часов 100-150 вас точно хватит на высокой сложности. Но вот если у вас нету данной игры, то покупать её за полную цену - максимально не советую. Только если на скидках и то, как инвестицию в её будущее развитие.

184982815.review: This game is great. It has come a long way and it scratches an itch I have had with playing Rust. I love the base building and need for scavenging houses and buildings in order to find useful knowledge and loot to help your skills along the way. There are quest givers in various locations and and UI that you can set how you want to make the game easier, harder or somewhere in between. You can crank up the loot drop rate or mess with the zombies walk - run speed. The game has a lot of potential as it grows and gets updates. There is even a dedicated server that you can install along side the game and either host if you have the rig or rent a server online to use your dedicated server. Either way I hope the developers keep adding new content and good qaulity of life changes to the game.

184946117.review:
Nicht empfehlenswert auf dem Steam Deck.
Wahrscheinlich besser mit Maus und Tastatur. Der Einstieg ist etwas frustrierend am Anfang. Kann aber an der Steuerung liegen, weil man nicht so gut reagieren kann.

Die Grundstruktur ist eine Mischung aus "The Infected" und Minecraft. Das Bausystem basiert auf Blöcken mit festen Größen, wie bei Minecraft. Die Welt hat eine Ähnlichkeit mit "The Infected"
Eine richtige Story konnte ich noch nicht entdecken, aber das kann im späteren Verlauf noch kommen.

Diese Rezension bezieht sich jetzt erstmal nur auf das Steam Deck, hier würde ich das Spiel nicht empfehlen.
Auf dem Deck ist die Grafik sehr minimalistisch und die Texturen sind sehr verwaschen. Man kann die Qualität auch nicht höher stellen, weil das Spiel das nicht zulässt wegen zu wenig Ram.

Am Deck kann es eher nicht liegen, weil z.B. Hogwarts Legacy mit sehr guter Grafik läuft.

Vielleicht gibts dafür irgendwann bessere Proton Settings.

Am PC muss sich das Spiel erst noch beweisen.

184928997.review:
丧尸生存建造探索游戏，这游戏十几年了，没想到前几年突然更新把画质更新了，好消息是画面直接质变，坏消息是丧尸更真实恐怖了。官方还把丧尸塞到各种犄角旮旯里用各种东西遮掩着，突出一个：进屋有惊喜，转角有惊喜，回头有惊喜，头顶有惊喜，开门有惊喜，点个开关更是有大大的惊喜。
建造方式有点像MC，不过建筑是从木框架开始搭建，用木板，鹅卵石，水泥和钢锭加固转变，加固手里得有个羊角锤或者石斧用右键。扳手和棘轮是拆车，拆机器用的。
商人的商店晚上会关门，会把玩家踢出去。做任务的话，进房子跟着灯光走，比如手电筒，蜡烛，提灯，遇到打不开的门不要拆，作者设定好了一条固定路线。入口有可能是从门进去，也有可能是从梯子爬到楼顶进去，也有可能是从窗户进去。乱拆门可能导致你迷路，或者丧尸不刷新导致任务无法完成。

184903632.review: This game holds a special place in my heart. From playing at launch on the older version on the ps4, it's been quite a journey to see what this game has become. The game is super fun and is most enjoyable in the beginning to middle stages of playtime. My biggest complaint is how it runs sometimes and the endgame. The game has always been plagued with poor optimization and it's gotten a little bit better with time, but still needs heavy work done to it. Also the endgame is really boring when you get to it with no incentive to keep going im my opinion. Getting started, building a base with traps and defenses, looting, killing, leveling up, and everything involved with getting more geared and upgraded as a player is a blast. Sadly, once your done with all of this and your base is done and you have the gear you want, I find that surviving hordes can just get boring. I suppose work arounds for this can be personal challenge runs, new base designs, different build playthroughs, and other things of the sort, but just wish for a different end game. Besides that, the game is 100% worth it with the devs dedicated to the game and already showing off whats to come after their recent full release.

184895551.review:
I won't lie, when I first got this game a few years ago; It was thrilling, fun, and exciting. Learning the systems, how zombies worked, crafting and skills; all of it was done quite well. up-to about this year. I noticed with the recent patches that it's no longer becoming a true sand-box game, the poi's now have sort of "paths" to follow with traps and whatnot, which makes it repetitive at times. Another issue I have is before you could get glass jars and fill up a jar with murky water and cook it; and boom! clean water to drink. But now? they make you get a dew collector, then a gatherer, then a tarp, then a filter; which isn't found until a good amount of time is spent playing in game. In what world does guns come before a natural source of water? Like cmon. This game is a bit embarassing to play when I am able to max out my weapons before I'm able to craft vehicles, food, teas, and other basic recipes. Example? The Crucible isn't able to be obtained until you get 75/75 workstations, which is useless by the time you get it because you've already got the best loot available from poi's; including teir 6 loot.

Don't even get me started on this games optimization, I've seen a pregnancy tests run doom; yet a nasa super computer couldn't run this cunt game at 60+ fps constant. 

PLEASE FIX UR SHIT FACEPUNCH THIS GAME IS HORRENDOUS!!!

if you like base building i guess its alright.

184822772.review:
После 50 часов, проведенных в 7 Days to Die, я могу с уверенностью сказать, что это один из лучших проектов в жанре выживания. Теперь, после выхода из альфа-тестирования в 2024 году, игра достигла своей зрелости и предлагает игрокам завершенный, богатый контентом продукт. Она сочетает в себе элементы выживания, строительства и борьбы с ордами зомби, что делает её невероятно увлекательной.

Плюсы игры
Атмосфера постапокалипсиса
В мире 7 Days to Die вы буквально чувствуете себя в центре зомби-апокалипсиса. 🧟‍♀️ Разрушенные города, темные леса и пустоши создают мрачную, но завораживающую атмосферу. Постоянное ощущение угрозы делает каждую минуту геймплея напряженной и увлекательной.

Глубокая система выживания
Игра предлагает детализированную механику выживания: от поиска еды и воды до создания оружия и построек. 🌿 Крафтинг стал еще более интуитивным, а элементы выживания гармонично вписываются в игровой процесс.

Эпическая механика "7-го дня"
Ключевая особенность игры – "судный день", когда каждые 7 дней на вас обрушивается волна зомби. 💀 Эти моменты заставляют проверять прочность вашей базы и ваши навыки планирования. Удовольствие от успешной обороны сравнимо с ощущением победы в стратегической игре.

Процедурная генерация мира
Каждый новый старт предлагает уникальную карту, благодаря чему игра всегда остается свежей и интересной. 🌍 Исследование биомов и поиск редких ресурсов добавляют драйва.

Разнообразие контента
После выхода из альфа-тестирования игра обзавелась богатым контентом: улучшенной системой крафта, новым оружием, улучшенными анимациями и обширным деревом навыков. 🎯

Кооперативный режим
В компании друзей игра раскрывается еще больше. Совместное строительство базы, борьба с зомби и разведка мира приносят массу удовольствия. 🤝

Оптимизация и технические улучшения
После выхода из альфы разработчики значительно улучшили оптимизацию игры. Теперь даже масштабные постройки и массовые сражения с ордами зомби проходят гладко. 💻

Минусы игры
Графика остается устаревшей
Несмотря на выход из альфа-версии, визуальная составляющая игры все еще не соответствует современным стандартам. Некоторые текстуры и модели выглядят примитивно, особенно на фоне новых игр в жанре. 🎨

Условная сложность эндгейма
После того, как база укреплена и ваши навыки доведены до максимума, волны зомби могут становиться предсказуемыми и не такими уж сложными.

Пороги входа для новых игроков
Система инвентаря и крафта может показаться сложной и перегруженной для новичков. 📦 Хоть это и часть уникального стиля игры, некоторым потребуется время, чтобы освоиться.

Заключение
7 Days to Die – это игра, которая с каждым часом раскрывается все больше. Она объединяет в себе элементы выживания, строительства и боевых механик, предлагая насыщенный и напряженный геймплей. Да, графика и интерфейс могли бы быть лучше, но эти недостатки меркнут перед обилием контента и атмосферой.

С выходом из альфа-тестирования игра достигла стабильности, которая позволяет наслаждаться всеми её аспектами без технических проблем. Если вы любите жанр выживания и не боитесь сражаться с ордами зомби, 7 Days to Die подарит вам десятки (или даже сотни) часов захватывающего геймплея.

Рекомендую попробовать, особенно в кооперативе – игра станет незабываемым опытом! 🧟‍♂️
