184802697.review:
This might just be one of my favourite games, ever.
After watching the Neebs Gaming crew play this in a series of videos, I bought 5 copies. Yes, 5.
I have a LAN setup at my shop with dedicated Steam accounts for each PC, so I bought 5 copies to use on the shop PCs for  anyone to play when they visit. Anyway, about the game...
It's fun, plain and simple. There are genuine jump scare moments that can be panic-inducing. 7DTD is a game where you can play however you want. Do you want to experiment with building a seemingly impregnable fortress anywhere on the map to keep the zambies out on Horde night? You can do that. Would you rather run around like the Pied Piper leading a massive Conga Line of zambies around on Horde Night instead? You can do that too. You can explore, dig, shoot, destroy, build, repair, drive, fly, and swim all around the entire map. 
Think of this game as everything a 'Fallout' game should be, with absolute building freedom, and weapons that actually kill.
8.75/10

184798971.review:
7 Days to Die. Oh the memories. This is an incredibly hardcore survival game that I love. The first thing I noticed about the game is how ugly it is. It reminded me of Fallout: New Vegas which is another game I love. The world is voxel-based (minecraft) so you can build your own house, add on to existing structures, create unique barricades and traps, ect.

I especially enjoy the pace of this game. This isn't run and gun, the action is mid and isn't entirely the focus. This game is about exploration, loot management and crafting, and base defense. This is where the game shines. It is also very fun with friends. As long as you don't play with unemployed people who hop onto your server, grinds all day and basically unlocks everything while you are at work. I'm looking at you, David. The grind is the fun part, I can't believe you ruined that and thought you were doing me a favor. Like we had just started the game and then I come back the next day and you have a Gyrocopter. Not cool, dude. And it was a dedicated server that I paid for! Sorry. The game is really good.

184749928.review:
Ive bought this game for around 7 euros a couple of years ago and I feel it is not worth more than 15 euros. Ive had lots of fun with this game but I have to say I expected a whole lot more from the full release of this game. From Alpha to full release there have only been a handful of changes surely not enough to brand it as "full release" now worth 44 euros. Im going to share some of the things I dislike about the game now:

1. Trader Quests: Back in the days Trader Quests were completely optional now it has become pretty much the essence of the game: You wont find yourself exploring the world youre more likely to run back and forth from trader to quests for the first 30 days. All day. Every day.

2. Its not possible to drink from rivers or stillwaters anymore, the goal of this was to have the players focus more on the actual survival aspect. I dont think it does a lot but oh well. Its terrible for new players who dont know what to do and just more annoying for players with more hours, adding nothing to the gameplay experience imo. You will have to buy water filters from the traders instead to keep up with your water supply in the long term, which are very expensive in the early game.

3. Skill advancement: (Subjective) Although the changes in skill progression were meant to combat the rng aspect of finding the schematics you needed I found myself enjoying the old system a whole lot more. Sure, it was frustrating to look for that one schematic you needed to progress in the game but the new system just cannot match the happiness when you luck out and find some really good schematics. Whereas if I find books now that give me a skillpoint its just kind of a "oh a book ok whatever" moment. Additionally if you play with friends you would ideally have one person learn one half of skills and the other the other half. (If you wanted to progress as quickly as possible you would have to carry all the books for your duo which takes up a shitload of inventory space.)

4. Perks/Skilltree: There have been a few skilltree adjustment throughout the patches, mostly for balance. For an alpha version of the game I was okay with skilltrees being unbalanced some skills being a must pick others straight up useless. What I didnt expect for the full release was that pretty much nothing changed. Sure they nerfed buffed a few things here or there but there are still those 5 perks you always go for and the other 5 you just never pick because its a waste of skillpoints regardless of playstyle. 

5. Performance Issues: If you had a NASA pc this game wouldnt run on more than 120 fps. It just is what it is. Given that the graphics are not overwhelming I find it highly questionable that cyberpunk on high graphic settings runs better on my pc than this game on medium. 

Of course there are some other minor things I dislike but since theyre too subjective I wont go into them.
There are also a lot of things I really love about the game that I didnt mention. If youre into building your own houses you have a whole lot more options than in other games. 
You can just pick up vehicles which makes absolutely no sense but I love it.
A skilltree to spend skillpoints on as you progress in the game (yes I listed it as a negative example  because I expected more from it being a full release 44 euro game) 
etc. etc.


Although I really loved this game the full release has been very disappointing to me and if I had to buy it again paying full price knowing what it is right now, I wouldnt pay it.

184727498.review:
Game 3/365

I thought I would give this game a try as part of a 1 game a day challenge I set myself for the next year.

This really surprised me and I really enjoyed playing it. It was straightforward to setup and get into a game. After dying a few times I started to get to grips with the system and started working through the tutorial quests. The crafting system is pretty good and there is lots to make once you start harvesting resources. 

I found it mildly amusing that when I crafted a club, it was a grotesque club with blood dripping down it and bits sticking out of it. Pretty obvious what Im going to be using that for!

The game felt very similar to Fallout 76 but also unique in its own right. Basically whats not to love about crafting and killing zombies! I would be happy picking this up and having a go when Im in the mood. Its easy to get started from where you last left it.

Overall impressions is very positive. I thought this was an enjoyable game that I would be revisiting.

Graphics 4/5
Gameplay 4/5
Replayability 3/5
Difficulty 3/5

184698513.review:
First let me Preface this by saying this inst exactly a Recommendation to buy this game or to not buy this game

 Back When i started playing 7 Days almost 5 years ago [Alpha 18 or 19] i started playing with a IRL friend, this Friend got me to buy the game, skeptical at first i didn't know what to expect, but i started to really enjoy the game, and found it utterly addicting, the game play loop is great and it worked, a little after the release of alpha 20 i would end up dropping the game, mainly because i had played it a lot at the time and that me and my IRL friend had a dumb falling, when i came back to play around 5 years later, i found that a lot of things had changed, some good but there was a lot of things that were changed that made me love the game in the first place, one of them being the Crafting system changes, the learn by Reading system is Garbage and should not exist, the Water changes that were introduced in A21 also are really dumb, and overall TFP had been forcing a more Linear style of Gameplay onto the player, with little to no inbetween, essentially making only one style of gameplay viable for the player, instead of letting the player chose how they wanted to play, this game has gone from a Fun survival Sandbox, Tower defense game, to a Dumb Down looter Shooter, with lack luster RPG Elements, with some of the most monotonous gameplay, quite literally Fallout 4 Radiant Quest Tier, This game quite literally Skyrim with guns now, Alpha 20 and Prior is where it was at.

If you want to play this game i highly recommend get it on Sale because back when i bought it was 20$ or something, and also play on Alpha 20 or before, just go to your propties tab Then Beta and set it in the beta drop down.

184655679.review:
Может быть эта игра и была выносом мозга ещё в далеком 13-м году на хайпе зомби-сеттинга и нашумевшего раннее майнкрафтом, с которого разрабы слизали систему строительства, превратив игру в своеобразный майнкрафт-с-пушками...

...Но сейчас, после официально релиза игру воспринимать просто невозможно и ещё за такую не адекватную цену - красный ценник игры от силы ~500 рубликов но никак не полторы тыщи рублей, за такие большие деньги вы получаете:

* Уeбищный кривой движок, который не умеет нормально работать с играми жанра открытого мира, что влечет за собой ужасную оптимизацию и лаги с вылетами даже на топовых компах

* Отвратительный античит, за все мои года жизни эта единственная игра что может довести комп до синего экрана смерти только потому что античит во время запуска что-то не нашел в файлах вашего компа и поэтому выносит ваш комп наxуй

* Ужасная генерация карты где 80% пространства это пустые поля и не адекватные каньоны выкрученные в овер-доxyя градусов вверх при условии что вы можете находится в обычном спальном частном секторе на равнине где такие горы как я описал ранее просто физически не могут существовать в реальной жизни. Край карты это вообще кошмар, каньон на каньоне, отличный симулятор получения дебаффа от перелома костей от постоянного перепада высоты, о чём думал разраб когда такое дeрьмо кодил - не понятно
 
Лучше поиграйте в старый добрый майн, а в эту игру заходите лучше только в пиратку, потому что тех денег что она просит с проблемами что я описал выше - просто отвратительное отношение к потребителю

184630368.review: 什么时候把书籍系统改了什么时候改成好评。从最早砍树树会倒，武器材质全靠一把一把造，到处找设计书，空罐子和水瓶到处捡水烧着喝的版本就在玩了，现在玩只感觉很无聊，前几个测试版的时候玩的像任务达人，天天从早到晚做任务，现在任务奖励拉垮了变搜刮，结果搜刮还是搜刮做任务的时候的楼的东西才多；清理任务也有点恶心，有的房子搞得晕头转向的，也不指明哪个地方还有僵尸；挺过前期以后材料就很多了，足够做后期的东西，但是因为这个沟槽的书籍系统导致被卡着进度，被逼着到处找书看，学霸套是必备的了这下，颇有种被教着玩游戏的感觉。游戏还是好游戏，联机玩玩确实不错，除去后期相对无聊这点以外还算不错的生存游戏，就是这个正式版价格感觉也有点逆天了。以上仅为个人长期游玩下来的感受与观点，欢迎友好讨论和指正。

184618266.review:
I absolutely adored 7 Days to Die for so many years now. It was a really fun survival game with so much charm and replayability.

I have to say, that Alpha 19 was the peak of this game, and it has gone very much downhill from there. 

The developers have butchered this game into a soulless husk of what it once was. We know the age old saying of "If it isn't broken, don't fix it" Well the devs have completely ignored this, revamping so many already decent systems like the water collection, or the traders.

Every POI feels like a dungeon, not an actual place. 

You can't spawn in other biomes other than the Pine forest, because of the new progression system, which sort of solidifies this game as very arcady, which isn't a bad thing per se, but with 7 Days, for me it is.

The traders are now biome specific, and are over balanced.

One positive thing I can mention is the mods, the modding community is vibrant with a lot of full game overhaul mods, which is the only way I will probably play 7 Days to Die again.

If you have friends and enjoy co-op, then this is a must play, back in the day, there used to be a bundle pack to purchase for a discount, but not anymore apparently. 

I purchased this game in 2021, when it still used to be a reasonable price. It seems like the devs slapped on a 1.0 sticker to increase the price, even though it just feels like another alpha. The game is very undercooked. If I saw this game now, I probably wouldn't buy it, it's just ridiculous

This is my first negative review ever, and I wouldn't have done one, if this game, the way it's going didn't hurt me as much as it did. I seriously loved this game, and it was one my favorite games for a fairly long time. It is a part of my childhood and it always will be. But for now, I have to give it a 5/10, used to be a solid 8/10. Seriously pains me to look at this game anymore, with it's missed potential.

La finesse des mécaniques du jeu procure une incroyable satisfaction lors des raids.
La liberté de construction permet de faire n'importe quoi et n'importe où pour se protéger et transforme le jeu en tower défense géant. 
Les raids sont généreux et très satisfaisant.
Il est cependant dommage que tout soit bloqué à "6", ça freine inutilement la rejouabilité.

+ La construction et le côté tower défense

Courage les devs ne lâchez pas vous avez une pépite dans les mains.

184537471.review:
[b]Genel Bakış[/b]


7 Days to Die, hayatta kalma, zombi temalı açık dünya ve inşa oyunu olarak oldukça geniş bir oyuncu kitlesine hitap ediyor. Oyun, zombi apokalipsinin olduğu bir dünyada, oyuncuların hayatta kalmaya çalıştığı, sürekli değişen ve gelişen bir çevrede geçiyor. İnşa etme, kaynak toplama, savunma yapma, keşif ve hayatta kalma üzerine odaklanıyor. Zombiler ve çevresel faktörler, oyuncuyu sürekli tehdit altında tutuyor. Aynı zamanda, açlık, susuzluk ve yorgunluk gibi hayatta kalma unsurlarına dikkat etmeniz gerekiyor. Fakat, oyun hem tek oyunculu hem de çok oyunculu modlarıyla ciddi bir deneyim sunuyor.

[b]Oynanış Mekanikleri[/b]
Oyun dünyası büyük ve keşfedilmeyi bekleyen birçok alan içeriyor. Kaynak toplamak, barınak inşa etmek ve korunaklı bölgeler oluşturmak, hayatta kalmanın temel unsurlarından. Fakat en büyük tehdit zombi salvosu oluyor; oyun, her 7. günde zombi dalgalarını tespit ediyor ve oyuncunun hazırlıklarını test etmeye başlıyor. Bu döngü çok eğlenceli olsa da, oyun uzun süre oynandığında monotonlaşabilir. Zorluk artışı ve ölüm mekanikleri ilginç, ancak özellikle çok uzun bir süre oynandığında, bazı oyuncular tekrar eden görevleri ve öldürme taktiklerini sıkıcı bulabilir. Ayrıca, oyun herhangi bir kesin hikâyeye sahip değil, büyük ölçüde oyuncunun dünya içerisinde karşılaştığı durumlarla ilerliyor.

[b]Grafikler ve Ses[/b]
Grafikler genel olarak iddialı değil, ancak açık dünya zombi hayatta kalma konseptini yansıtmak için yeterli derecede iyi. Ortam detayları güzel işlenmiş ve apokaliptik bir atmosfer yaratılıyor; fakat zaman zaman düşük çözünürlükte tekstürlerle karşılaşılarak görsellikte kopukluklar yaşanabiliyor. Aynı zamanda karakter animasyonları ve zombi tasarımları bazı oyuncular için biraz eski kalabilir. Ses tasarımı, özellikle zombi sesleri ve gece ortamlarında daha etkili bir şekilde işlerken, ara ara teknik bozukluklar ve ses seviyeleri konusunda bazı sıkıntılar olabiliyor. Bununla birlikte, ortam sesleri ve gergin hava yaratma konusunda oyun başarılı.

[b]Zorluk ve Derinlik[/b]
Oyun çok zorlu bir hayatta kalma deneyimi sunuyor. Karakterin sürekli yemek, su, barınma gibi temel ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak zorunda kalıyorsunuz. Ek olarak, oyuncunun hayatta kalmak için kaynakları biriktirme, inşa etme ve zombi dalgalarına karşı savunma yapma gibi çok yönlü bir stratejiye sahip olması gerekiyor. Ancak, diğer zombi hayatta kalma oyunlarına göre daha ağır bir eğim sunuyor. Oyunun yalnızca hayatta kalma modunda ilerlemek bile ciddi zaman alabiliyor ve işin içine zombi saldırıları, oyuncular arasındaki etkileşimler ve görevler de dahil edildiğinde, bu süre uzayabiliyor. Ne yazık ki, bu da bazı oyuncular için sıkıcı ve yorucu olabiliyor. Ayrıca, oyunun "7 gün" döngüsünün bir çeşit çerçeve sunmasına rağmen, bazı bölgelerde yavaş ilerleyen bir tempo olabilir.

[b]Pozitif:[/b]

-Derinlemesine hayatta kalma ve inşa mekanikleri
-Zorlu zombi saldırıları ve dalgalar
-Büyük açık dünya ve keşif imkânı
-Çok oyunculu modda eğlenceli bir deneyim

[b]Negatif:[/b]

-Görsel bozulmalar ve eski kalmış animasyonlar
-Tekrarlayan görevler ve rutinler, bazen sıkıcı olabiliyor
-Bazı ses ve teknik aksaklıklar
-Oyun mekanikleri, özellikle erken aşamalarda çok zorlayıcı olabilir

[b]Genel Değerlendirme[/b]
[b]Oynanış:[/b] 7/10 (Hayatta kalma unsurları ve zombi saldırıları oldukça eğlenceli, fakat bazı oyun öğeleri tekrara düşebiliyor)
[b]Grafikler:[/b] 6/10 (Grafikler bazen eski kalıyor ve bazı çözünürlük sorunları yaşanabiliyor)
[b]Hikaye:[/b] 6/10 (Oyun, çok açık uçlu bir hikâye sunuyor fakat derinlik açısından eksik)
[b]Genel:[/b] 7/10

[b]Sonuç[/b]
7 Days to Die, zombi hayatta kalma türünün birçok yönünü bir araya getiriyor. Büyük bir açık dünya, derin hayatta kalma mekanikleri ve çok oyunculu mod ile eğlenceli anlar sunabiliyor. Ancak, oyunun tekdüzeleşebilen döngüleri, grafiksel eksiklikler ve bazı teknik aksaklıklar, deneyimi zaman zaman olumsuz etkileyebiliyor. Bu oyun, zorlu bir hayatta kalma deneyimi ve keşif arayan oyuncular için ideal olabilir, fakat rahatlayıp sadece eğlenmek isteyenler için biraz yorucu olabilir.

184517827.review:
В 7 Days to Die игрок появляется в случайно сгенерированном месте с целью прожить так долго, как это возможно. Как в лесах и пустошах, так и в вымерших населённых пунктах разгуливает большое количество заражённых и когда проходит день и наступает ночь, зомби становятся более сильными и агрессивными. В игре есть возможность крафта, уничтожения и другие способы манипулирования объектами. Также в игре есть система физики, в которой строительство без поддержки (опор, колонн, стен и т.д) может привести к обрушению или частичному разрушению здания. Игра построена на основе воксельной технологии, что позволяет использовать искусственную физику для постройки и уничтожения объектов на гладкой местности.

Игра сосредоточивается на том, чтобы дать игрокам возможность выживать и днём, и ночью, так как в ней имеется дневной и ночной цикл. Днём зомби медленные и слабые, но в ночное время они становятся более быстрыми опасными и каждую седьмую ночь на игрока идёт волна мутантов, которая обнаруживает его, не имея визуального контакта с ним. В игре есть система, благодаря которой персонажу требуется еда и вода для поддержания своей жизнедеятельности, также на него постоянно воздействуют внешние факторы, температура, болезни, радиация и вирус. Предметы в игре постепенно разрушаются в процессе их использования, поэтому игроку придется искать новые или делать их самому и ремонтировать по ходу игры с помощью системы крафта.

В настоящее время игра находится в стадии альфа-тестирования, поэтому в ней ещё нет всех запланированных функций. Мир полностью разрушаемый. Игрок может вырыть шахту или котлован сколь угодно больших размеров, ограничивающиеся только размерами мира и затратами времени, построить свой собственный дом или уничтожить другие, чтобы собрать материалы, например, для строительства своей крепости. В игре также присутствует возможность маскировки и система отвлечения, чтобы избежать столкновений с зомби.

Зомби в 7 Days to Die (в зависимости от вида) могут лазить по стенам, копать, разрушать объекты или даже целые здания, если это необходимо, чтобы добраться до игрового персонажа и убить его. Это заставляет игрока защищать свою базу, ставя различные ловушки и препятствия, чтобы туда попадались зомби. После каждой смерти на игрока накладывается штраф, отнимающий некоторое количество игрового опыта.

Многопользовательская игра
Данный режим в игре доступен через серверы, создаваемые игроками. Он позволяет нескольким игрокам выживать и общаться друг с другом в одном мире. Выживание в игре может быть как с друзьями, так и против других игроков, в зависимости от используемых параметров сервера. Одиночные миры имеют поддержку локальной сети, позволяющую другим игрокам присоединяться к выбранному миру локально, без установки сервера. Игрок может разрешить подключаться к своему одиночному миру через глобальную сеть. Существует несколько режимов игры: «выживание» и «редактор».

184475576.review:
I've played this game on and off since the PS4 version was released 8 years ago. 

Unfortunately, in that time this game has continued to be updated by developers who have no earthly clue what they're doing with this game, and with absolutely no clear vision for it going forward. It has been a constant game of "One Step Forward, Two Steps Back"

As someone who owns both versions, switching between the two is rather embarrassing given the EIGHT YEAR difference in development time, with most features being removed or greatly reduced in importance. I'll provide a list here.

Cooking: Recipes are no longer found. You just magically know how to make food now if you find skill magazines(Skill Magazines are another travesty I'll get to later.) The recipes are also nonsensical. Hobo stew is made with rotten meat. It is somehow healthier for you than the exact same recipe made with NON-ROTTEN meat. Spaghetti, Tuna on Toast, and Fish tacos are some of the healthiest foods in the game. A stew made with fresh vegetables and hunted meat is mid tier, as is Literal Steak and potatoes. Bear in mind, those "healthy" recipes are made with canned food from the apocalypse.

The drinks provided are also completely illogical, giving ridiculously powerful buffs. This is the only game I've ever seen where drinking an energy drink makes you move faster than riding a literal bicycle at max speed. Nevermind Beer turning your character into a killing machine. If you're going to add things nobody asked for, at least make them logical.

Level Up System: It's now essentially a ripped off Fallout 3/4 type system with Skill Magazines that you FIND JUST LYING AROUND giving you all of your Skills. On PS4, it's essentially a ripped off Skyrim leveling system. Previously doing something made you get better at doing it. Now, you just dump points into base stats until you get a perk. The community has been very vocal that the New system is garbage. Radio silence on that one from the Devs. It was brought up in the last game update thread on Steam within the first 2 posts, Mods closed the thread within 4 hours. It's very clear that someone has arrogantly decided they know what makes a game good, and are blatantly ignoring their player base. 

Weather: On PS4, the weather is a constant threat to your survival. Walk into a blizzard with nothing on, and you will die. Walk into the desert with no water and you will die. Clothing mattered and there were different types for different situations. Now, clothing has been REMOVED and replaced with armor sets, another Fallout 3/4 system rip-off. Not that it matters. You can walk into a blizzard wearing nothing now, and not die because they essentially nerfed the entire system. There is NO REASON to even focus on weather biomes, as they are just basically texture packs by this point. Way to brick your own game mechanic, I guess.

Farming: Farming on PS4 requires you to till the soil and is dependent on weather(Rain makes things grow faster) Farming now requires you to craft a farming plot....aaaaaaand that's it. Right click with a seed, and you're a farmer now boi. Time frame is identical on all crops and weather has no effect, from what I can tell. Seeds are crafted from the crop itself. For example, you have to destroy 3 potatoes to get 3 potato seeds. I guess our characters are just eating the seeds and pits from the fruits and vegetables we're eating, like idiots, as that's the only explanation as to why seeds aren't generated upon consumption like you have happen in REAL LIFE. Great, more removed features and stupid implementations of others that no one asked for. 

Crafting: It's identical with no changes between the two versions. Thank god, you boys at least didn't ruin that. While I'm here though, can anyone explain to me in a game with farming and crops, why making cigars requires random plant matter and animal testosterone? Instead of, Oh I don't know, actual Tobacco? What a hackeyed workaround that seriously makes me question your intelligence and work ethic. 

Physics: The physics engine has not changed at all in 8 years. Gravity matters, sort of. Its' extremely basic and hackey. It was acceptable 8 years ago, now there is no excuse. I'm still waiting for them to just remove it without a word in a future update, much like the above mentioned temperature effects. 

Graphics: Graphics are the only thing that have improved in the 8 years. Whoopie, I guess. PS4 version graphics are still acceptable, and realistically, for there have been 8 years of dev time, the graphics are still trash. Way to go guys. I appreciate losing Split Screen, just so I can watch virtual boobs bounce on a dead zombies body. That really added to the overall immersion of the game, I'm totally locked in now /s

Gameplay: It's identical. 8 years of development and the game is essentially a greatly feature reduced version of the PS4 version. 

Buy the PS4 version, it's an actual survival game. The next gen is basically just run around and collect loot. PS4 is unfortunately the superior game by this point and significantly more immersive. The devs of this game should be ashamed of themselves. 

Buying this trash is just throwing your money away.

184424884.review:
Auch nach langer Spielpause, weil man schon durch war mit einem "normalen" Spiel, kann es selbst bei nur mittelleichtem Schwierigkeitsgrad nochmal spannend werden im Single-Player:

- Vor Spielbeginn im Reiter "Fortgeschritten" die "Beutemenge" auf Minimum stellen (25%). Denn das meiste ist alles früher schon geplündert worden, als es noch andere Menschen in diesem Gebiet gab. Und JA, es ist frustrierend kaum was zu finden im Loot, aber survival ist auch kein Kindergeburtstag, es geht um's Überleben!  Und die Freude an Erfolgen ist ja generell im Leben umso größer, je schwerer sie erreichbar waren!
- "Wiedererscheinen von Beute" und "Zurücksetzen des Blocks" wird natürlich beides deaktiviert. Leergelootetes bleibt leer, und kaputtgemachtes bleibt kaputt, auch wenn die Zombies schuld waren.
- "Todesmalus" : "Nichts"...  Verloren ist Verloren = Neue Runde, neues Glück.
- "Fallenlassen bei Tod" : auf  "ALLES LÖSCHEN" einstellen!  Ihr werdet merken, da geht euch der A**** auf Grundeis Überleben zu wollen, und es erfordert andere Taktiken im Spiel.
- "Erscheinen der Gegner": "An". Das gibt zwischendurch immer nochmal den Kick während ihr euch schon in scheinbarer Sicherheit wägt.
- Der "EP-Multiplikator" kann im Reiter "Allgemein" anfangs auch noch halbiert werden und später schrittweise erhöht werden. Denn man levelt anfangs viel zu schnell. Umso mehr werdet ihr euch freuen, wenn ihr dann was erreicht.
- Die im Reiter "Grundeinstellungen" etwas falsch genannte "Blutmonddauer" (Verzögerung) kann etwas erhöht werden, dadurch kommt die Horde-Nacht nämlich -irgendwann- später, und ihr könnt nicht mehr schon am ~Datum~ errechnen, wann wieder Horde sein wird. Außerdem wird der Durchschnittsspieler genug mit dem Ingame-Alltag zu tun haben, auch ohne den ständigen Blutmond-Klimmbimm. 
- "Abwürfe aus der Luft" auf "nicht markieren", ihr habt schließlich kein GPS-Tracker für solche Kisten. Wenn ihr schon ein Fortbewegungsmittel habt, müsst ihr halt sehr schnell rausgehen wenn ihr den Motorensound der Flieger hört. Und dann straight auf Kurs in die Richtung des Rauchsignals bleiben. Ihr habt auf dem Weg dorthin die Orientierung verloren oder es ist nebelig? = PECH GEHABT DIESMAL !

- Ingame  dann einfach mal nicht im grünen Anfangs-Biom häuslich einrichten, sondern SOFORT in die schwierigeren Gebiete gehen. 
- Dazu das Tabu, das Händler-Gelände nicht besuchen zu dürfen; es gibt KEINEN anderen lebenden Menschen mehr in dieser Zone, außer dir. 
- Noch funktionierende Getränke- /Naschkram-Automaten sind nur mit den einzelnen, gefundenen "Jetons" nutzbar. Mietautomaten beim Händler sowieso gar nicht. Da gibt's schließlich auch keine anderen Käufer mehr für.

- Leider wurden auch schon Dinge durch die Entwickler vereinfacht: Der Tausammler kann jetzt recht schnell gebaut werden, auch ohne die nur seltene Dropchance des damals noch notwendigen Wasserfilters im Loot. Und bei Nacht konnte man früher NICHTS sehen ohne Lichtquelle. Die Helmlicht-Mod irgendwann zu finden löste damals noch Euphorie aus, als ob man den heiligen Gral gefunden hätte. 
- Trotzdem, jetzt heißt es schleichen (oder sogar einzelne Schritte nur machen), Dreckwasser saufen und jeden Tag draußen was zu Essen finden, ohne Händler und Questbelohnungen. 
 Sei ein Mann und "die hard" !!

Esse jogo é basicamente o que acontece quando você mistura Minecraft, The Walking Dead e aquele seu amigo que só faz besteira nas horas mais importantes.

Você começa de boas, quebrando umas árvores e construindo uma casinha, até que, do nada, 7 dias se passam e você morre. Dá pra construir coisas insanas, brigar com os amigos por causa da base que caiu (sim, acontece muito) e passar meia hora esperando o comerciante abrir só pra gastar tudo em besteira.

Está bugado? Sim. É maravilhoso? Também. Jogar com amigos só deixa uma experiência mais caótica e engraçada.

Obs: não construa na agua.
Obs²: os mods salvam muito o game.

ソロでもマルチでも楽しいゾンビサバイバルクラフトゲーム！
7日ごとにゾンビの大群があなたの拠点を襲撃してきます。
それまでに荒廃した世界を練り歩き、物資をかき集めて生存しよう。
Falloutとかで探索して物資集めるのが好きな人はハマると思います。

設定で易しくも難しくも調整できるので、プレイしててぬるすぎ？辛すぎ？と思ったら調整できるのが嬉しいところ。
バイオームによって厳しさも変わってくるので、慣れてきたらあえて過酷な土地で生活するのもアリ。
パーツがめちゃくちゃあるので建築も結構凝ることができ、豆腐ハウスからリアルな住宅まで幅広く作れます。

UIに慣れるまではとっつきにくい感じがありますが、慣れたら大丈夫でした。
まぁまぁデカめの容量とスペックを要求されますが、ぜひ友達とワイワイプレイしてもらいたい良いゲームです。

184320715.review:
更新一直没停过，从好久以前的A9就开始玩，后来号找不到了，重新又搞了两个号，每次更新都会玩一下。别人都说优点，我就来说一下个人感觉的缺点吧：
1.打击感偏弱，尤其是弓弩和近战；
2.前期发展速度比较随机，经常遇到摸不出来扳手需要买的情况，而前期能赚钱的途径很有限；
3.NPC任务奖励降低了之后，任务流基本被阉割了，只做任务养不活家了；
4.做四级和五级任务的时候经常找不到最后的几个触发点，而这些往往需要正常走流程开门按开关才会刷新僵尸，而很多1000血的门往往就是两镐子刨开了，导致清理任务特别难完成；
5.正式版更新后遗留了很多过去的东西，但是却无法装配，在商人处尤其明显；
6.游戏的承重计算比较神奇，会打一颗玉米导致整个房子垮塌；
7.玩多了之后套路比较反复，需要等下一次更新后再玩才能有点感觉；
8.没有官方的创意工坊，装mod需要去贴吧等地方自行安装；
9.部分技能是为了联机服务的，但是联机的体验比较一般，很少有那种欢乐时刻出现，没什么额外内容与惊喜；
10.讲了那么多，其实入手一个挺好的，游戏的发展前景很大，相比于一开始，更新了太多太多了。
以上

184279914.review:
7 Days to Die

Puntos a favor:
1-Gran variedad de Armas.
2-Variedad en cuanto a las construcciones y crafteos de items en general.
3-Desafiante experiencia de supervivencia zombi (sobre todo en tus primeras partidas)
4-Variedad de vehículos para craftear (lo mejor es craftear tu primera moto xD)
5-Personalización de personaje (algo decente)

Punto neutral:
1-Gráficamente no es la gran cosa.

Puntos en contra:
1-Alguna que otra baja de FPS en las hordas de zombis (antes era mucho peor pero sigue sucediendo)  
2-Algo tedioso y repetitivo.Lo mas entretenido en general son las primeras horas de una partida luego una vez mas o menos armado se torna aburrido.
3-La IA de los zombis ni bien mejoro muchísimo aun le faltan algunos retoques.

En resumen 7 Days to Die ofrece una experiencia bastante completa en cuanto a supervivencia zombi, te dará muchos momentos de entretenimiento por la gran cantidad de cosas que hay que hacer para sobrevivir. Aunque en el (late game) se torna repetitivo y aburrido.
Gran juego para jugar una tarde con tus amigos para las risas y desafiante para los jugadores en solitario. Juego recomendado sobre todo si esta en descuento. 

Nota: 7,5/10

184268350.review:
A Unique Survival Gem That Stands the Test of Time

7 Days to Die has been one of the most rewarding survival games I’ve played, and it’s a game I keep coming back to, even after years. It combines so many elements—survival, crafting, base building, exploration, and combat—into one cohesive experience that’s hard to find anywhere else.

At its core, 7 Days to Die is about surviving the zombie apocalypse, but what sets it apart is the depth of its systems. The constant need to scavenge, craft, and upgrade your base creates an addictive gameplay loop. Every seven days, a terrifying blood moon horde descends upon you, testing your preparations and forcing you to adapt. These moments are stressful but also incredibly satisfying when your traps and defenses hold the line.

The game’s crafting system is one of the best in the genre. It feels rewarding to scavenge junk from abandoned houses or derelict factories and turn it into something useful, whether it’s a makeshift weapon, upgraded armor, or reinforced walls for your base. The RPG-like skill progression adds another layer, letting you customize your playstyle, whether you want to focus on combat, stealth, or being the group’s builder.

Exploration is another highlight. The randomly generated worlds keep things fresh, and each biome offers unique challenges and rewards. I love the thrill of raiding a massive hospital or factory, knowing that danger could be around every corner.

Sure, the game has its quirks. The graphics aren’t cutting-edge, and there are occasional bugs, but none of that takes away from the experience. If anything, the rough edges add to its charm—it’s like a scrappy underdog that punches well above its weight.

What really makes 7 Days to Die special is how well it works with friends. Playing solo is great, but teaming up with others to build a fortress, plan raids, and fend off hordes is on another level. It’s one of those games where you end up with stories to tell long after the session ends, like the time the blood moon breached our defenses, and we scrambled to hold them off with pipe bombs and baseball bats.

For anyone who loves survival games, 7 Days to Die is a must-play. It’s far from perfect, but it’s ambitious, challenging, and endlessly replayable. After all these years, it’s still one of the best zombie survival experiences out there.

===[ Other Notes: ]===
As an OG fan of 7 Days to Die, I have been playing this game since 2016 in its early access on Steam, and it’s been amazing to see how much it has improved over the years. Back then, it was much rougher around the edges, with simpler mechanics and more bugs, but the developers have been consistently updating and expanding the game. It’s clear they’ve put a lot of effort into improving it, and it shows in the deeper crafting systems, better visuals, and more varied gameplay.
7 Days to Die blends survival, crafting, and base-building with a sprinkle of zombie horror. Set in a post-apocalyptic open world, the game challenges you to scavenge, craft, and fend off increasingly challenging zombie hordes, particularly during the infamous “blood moons” every seven days.

MY LIKES:
The core mechanics of survival, crafting, and base-building in 7 Days to Die have remained enjoyable, but the game has added a lot of depth over the years. The atmosphere is one of the best parts; whether it’s the eerie silence of the wasteland or the tension of hiding from hordes during the night, the game truly nails the survival experience. The developers have done a PHENOMENAL job capturing the terrifying essence of navigating the wasteland, especially through the game's sound design. The contrast between the dangers of the outside world and the relief you feel when returning to your home base is perfectly executed. There’s something deeply satisfying about the ability to build and modify your base however you want, allowing for endless creativity (though the game's physics can be a bit frustrating at times). As you gather better weapons, gear, and resources, the progression feels rewarding, especially when preparing for the intense Blood Moon hordes (Be sure to double-check your defences, 'cause nothing says 'oops' like running out of ammo when they're banging down your door). The recent updates have significantly improved the game’s graphics and performance, which were major issues in the past, and it’s clear that a lot of care has gone into updating the game. Overall, 7 Days to Die continues to shine with its immersive survival mechanics and constant improvements. I can tell that a lot of care has gone into updating this game, and it shows!

MY DISLIKES:
While 7 Days to Die has come a long way, there are still some issues that can break the immersion or make gameplay feel frustrating. One of the biggest complaints I have (and that I’ve seen from the community) is the clunky AI. Zombies can sometimes act in ways that feel unintentionally goofy, with their pathfinding being inconsistent. This lack of AI polish, particularly during horde nights, can undermine the tension that the game strives for. Another issue is the performance optimization. Despite the improvements, the game can still struggle to run smoothly on mid-range PCs, especially in later stages when the map is heavily populated with zombies and structures. This results in frame rate drops and stuttering, which can negatively affect the overall experience.
Additionally, while the random world generation is impressive, it can feel a bit repetitive. Some biomes or areas lack variety, and the world can sometimes feel too sparse or uninteresting to explore, making it hard to stay engaged with the environment. There’s also been some criticism regarding the lack of meaningful end-game content. While building and surviving is fun, once you’ve built up a powerful base and stockpiled resources, the game can feel like it loses some of its momentum, especially for players who prefer a more narrative-driven experience. Lastly, the game’s buggy elements are still a source of frustration. While there have been improvements, issues like clipping, texture bugs, and occasional crashes remain, and these can take players out of the experience (I can't tell you how many bones I've broken from the drawbridge glitch). The lack of a dedicated story also leaves some players wanting more structure and direction beyond the survival aspect.
These drawbacks don’t make the game unplayable, but they can occasionally detract from the overall experience, especially for those who are looking for a more polished, seamless survival game.

VERDICT:
Overall, 7 Days to Die has come a long way since its early days, and as a long-time fan, I can confidently say it’s improved massively over the years. While there are still some bugs and technical issues that can occasionally disrupt the experience, the core gameplay remains incredibly satisfying, especially if you're a fan of survival crafting and base-building. The atmosphere, sound design, and progression system really shine, and there’s a real sense of accomplishment when you successfully defend your base against the Blood Moon hordes. The recent updates have made a noticeable difference in the game’s performance and visuals, which is a huge plus. That said, there are still some areas that could use refinement, such as AI pathfinding, performance optimization on mid-tier PCs, and more endgame content. However, if you enjoy survival games and the freedom to create your own experience, 7 Days to Die is well worth a try. I’d recommend picking it up during a sale for the best value. It’s a game that's worth playing, but not without its flaws. It’s definitely one of the better survival games out there at full price too. I’m honored and beyond excited to continue witnessing the growth and evolution of 7 Days to Die in the years to come!
(DISCLAIMER- I originally purchased 7 Days to Die in 2016 for $11.19, and have been playing it ever since. My experience and perspective are based on this long-term engagement with the game, as well as the significant updates and improvements made over the years.)
I give this game a 7.5/10! 👍

184234334.review: Ich war zuerst ein wenig skeptisch. Die Illustrationen haben mir nicht gefallen im Trailer. Die alpha-Versionen sahen irgendwie nicht fertig aus. doch seit V1 (bis V1.2) und nachdem ich das Spiel im SP über 350 Std. gespielt habe, komm ich nicht mehr weg davon. Es ist wirklich das "Minecraft für Erwachsene". Die Menü-Einstellungen lassen viele Möglichkeiten, wie man spielen möchte. Mit Blutmond (also den Zombieangriff auf den Spieler nach einer bestimmten Zeit ) oder lieber friedfertiger. Das Bau-Menü benötigt etwas Eingewöhnungszeit, doch danach, kann man sich fast jeden Bauwunsch erfüllen. Und dem Spiel ist die "Nähe" zu der blockigen Welt von Minecraft auf den ersten Blick nicht wirklich anzusehen. Bugs haben sich im SP Spiel nur sehr sehr selten gezeigt. V.1.2 läuft nach meiner Erfahrung recht stabil. Die Unterstützung der Community mit Mods - um das Spiel nach seinen Wünschen weiter anzupassen - ist ebenfalls ein Plus. Fazit: mir wäre es sogar 40+X Euro wert, doch es gibt im Laufe des Jahres immer Rabatte, die man abwarten kann. Ich habe den Kauf nicht bereut.

184197758.review:
Наруто был опытным игроком в 7 Days to Die, и он знал, что в мире игры есть разные повороты и опасности. Он решил играть, чтобы испытать свои силы и попробовать выжить в этом постапокалиптическом мире. В один день он отправился на探ание в поисках припасов и оружия. В пути он наткнулся на группу зомби...
Наруто пришлось срочно скрыться от зомби и найти укромное место, где он мог бы отдохнуть и подготовиться к бою. Он нашел небольшой домик среди деревьев и решился войти внутрь. В комнате он заметил кровать и решил отдохнуть, но вдруг к нему вошла Сакура...
Сакура подошла к Наруто и крепко обняла его. Они долго смотрели друг другу в глаза, и внезапно Наруто почувствовал, как его сердце забилось быстрее. Он нежно провел пальцем по ее лицу, а затем аккуратно приобнял ее. Они стали говорить на разные темы, а их руки все больше и больше сжимали друг друга.
Внезапно во входную дверь постучали. Наруто напрягся и достал кунай, он готовился к бою. Они подошли к двери и медленно открыли ее. На пороге стоял Бо Синн, главный злодей, который был одержим игрой Five Nights at Freddy's.
Бо Синн вошел в дом и стал угрожать им. Он сказал, что собирается уничтожить их и отправить в ночь страха и ужаса, как в FNAF. Наруто готовился к бою, но Сакура стояла рядом с ним, готовая поддерживать его.
Пока Бо Синн продолжал говорить, в окно ворвалось несколько зомби. Наруто и Сакура быстро отреагировали и начали сражаться с зомби, отбиваясь от них кунаями и чакрой. Они сражались с большой решимостью, пытаясь защитить друг друга и себя.
Бо Синн подбросил свою волыну в воздух и ухмыльнулся. Он подмигнул Сакуре, а затем начал размахивать волыней, угрожая нанести удар по ней.

184195844.review:
Pros:

Immersive Survival Gameplay:
7 Days to Die combines survival mechanics with a unique blend of sandbox and RPG elements. Gathering, crafting, and scavenging create a satisfying loop that keeps players engaged.

Dynamic Horde System:
The “blood moon” event every seven in-game days brings relentless waves of zombies, forcing players to strategize and prepare defenses. This mechanic ensures a tense, exciting rhythm to the gameplay.

Deep Crafting System:
The crafting system is robust, offering hundreds of recipes for weapons, tools, armor, and building materials. The progression feels rewarding as players unlock new items and technologies.

Flexible Base Building:
The game supports highly customizable base building. Players can fortify abandoned buildings or construct sprawling compounds to withstand hordes. Creativity and practicality go hand in hand.

RPG Elements and Skill Progression:
With a variety of skills and perks, 7 Days to Die allows players to tailor their characters to preferred playstyles, whether as a combatant, crafter, or scavenger.

Open-World Exploration:
The procedurally generated maps are expansive, offering diverse biomes, abandoned towns, and hidden treasures. Exploration is both rewarding and dangerous.

Cooperative Multiplayer:
Playing with friends enhances the experience significantly. Coordinating defenses, dividing labor, and surviving together makes the gameplay more enjoyable and strategic.

Cons:

Outdated Graphics:
Despite its engaging mechanics, the graphics feel dated, with blocky textures and inconsistent animations detracting from the immersion.

Steep Learning Curve for Beginners:
The game lacks comprehensive tutorials, which can make it overwhelming for newcomers to understand survival mechanics, crafting, and base defense strategies.

Repetitive Gameplay:
Over time, scavenging and combat can become repetitive. The lack of significant variation in zombie AI or mission types might feel monotonous for long-term players.

Performance Issues:
Optimization remains a concern, with frequent frame drops, glitches, and crashes, especially on lower-end systems or during intense horde attacks.

Unbalanced Solo Play:
While playable solo, the experience can feel excessively challenging, particularly during later blood moons, which favor coordinated group efforts.

Overall Rating:
⭐⭐⭐⭐☆ (4/5)

7 Days to Die stands out as a unique survival horror game that blends sandbox creativity with tense zombie action. While it has its flaws in graphics and performance, its deep mechanics and engaging multiplayer experience make it a standout choice for survival enthusiasts.

184155203.review:
7 Days to Die" is a game that hooks you with its unique blend of survival mechanics, exploration, and crafting. For someone like me, who loves diving into every little city and exploring each building as its own mini-adventure, this game is an absolute treat. The world feels alive in its own desolate way, with treasures and challenges tucked into every corner.

The crafting system is another highlight, rewarding players as they scavenge for loot to build and improve their gear. Progression feels satisfying, especially when you move from the humble beginnings of building a bicycle to crafting a car to traverse the expansive map. The sense of accomplishment as you grow stronger and more resourceful is what keeps me coming back.

That said, there are a few areas where the game could improve. The lack of a narrative or human NPCs (friendly or hostile) makes the world feel a bit empty at times. While the gameplay loop is engaging, having a story or dynamic interactions with other survivors would elevate the experience significantly.

Still, "7 Days to Die" has a fantastic foundation to build upon. With its active community and potential for mods (especially on Steam), the possibilities for growth are endless. If you’re a fan of survival games that offer exploration, crafting, and an open-ended approach, this one is definitely worth your time.

184089415.review:
A Thrilling Test of Survival and Strategy: A Zombie Apocalypse Done Right

If you’re looking for a game that pushes your survival instincts to the limit while keeping you thoroughly entertained, this zombie survival and building game is an absolute gem. It’s not just about mowing down hordes of the undead (though that’s undeniably satisfying)—it’s about planning, perseverance, and adapting to an unforgiving world.

The game brilliantly combines resource management, base-building, and combat in a way that keeps you engaged. You’ll start with nothing but a desperate will to survive, scavenging for scraps and avoiding the relentless zombies that lurk around every corner. The difficulty spikes can be intimidating, especially when night falls or a horde comes your way, but every success—whether it’s crafting your first secure shelter or surviving a brutal attack—feels earned and deeply rewarding.

One of the most enjoyable aspects is the building system. Whether you’re constructing a simple barricade or an elaborate fortress, the tools and creativity the game allows make it exciting. But beware: no base is entirely safe, and the zombies have a way of forcing you to think on your feet, patching up weaknesses and preparing for the next wave.

The difficulty is part of the charm. It challenges you to think strategically about every choice you make—what resources to collect, how to defend yourself, and where to explore. The tension of risking it all for a rare item or deciding whether to save another survivor makes every moment feel meaningful.

Despite its challenges, the game is incredibly fun. From customizing your character to experimenting with unique builds and strategies, there’s always something new to try. The sense of progression is satisfying, as you go from a vulnerable scavenger to a confident survivor capable of facing down a horde.

If you’re up for a thrilling, sometimes punishing, but always rewarding experience, this game is a must-play. It’s a reminder that even in the face of a zombie apocalypse, creativity, determination, and a bit of luck can turn the tide.

184067533.review:
※このレビューは「７Days to die」を他人に買って与えることに何の躊躇いもない愛好家によるレビューです。

色んなサバイバルものをやってきたけれど、やっぱり一番おもろくて一番やりこみできるのは7dtdだなぁと思ったのでレビューを書きに来ました。いいから人類７Days to dieをやれ。

この作品はバニラでやってもよし、MODを入れてやってもよし、ソロで悪戦苦闘してもよし、マルチでわちゃわちゃ叫びながらやってもよし。ちょっと味変したいな、と思った時にいくらでも味を変えれる痒いところに手が届きやすい素敵なゲームです。
人それぞれ遊び方や遊ぶペースは違うもの。それを細かく調整できるのがこの作品の一番の良さでありアピールポイントです。何度噛んでも味がするやで。
ちょくちょく最新ゲームとテクスチャなどの画質を比較されて笑われることもあるけど、ゲーム難易度・出現物資量・自分と敵のダメージ倍率・敵の挙動・ゲーム内時間経過速度などなど。これらの項目以外にも細かく設定できるし、なんならオリジナルマップだって作れちゃう。素晴らしい、パーフェクトだ。

バニラ以外の味を楽しみたくなったら、全く別のゲームを起動してしまったのか？と思うくらい様変わりするMODを入れても良いし、ちょっとアイテム増えてﾀﾉｼ~くらいのささやかなMODを入れて元の素材の良さを生かしつつ楽しんでも良い。有志諸君本当にお世話になっております。
補足として、別ゲーか？と思うレベルの大型MODを入れる際は一緒に入れないといけない前提MODが複数ある場合があるので、そのあたりしっかり調べてから導入しよう。ついでにいうとそういう大型MODは大体英語圏の方々が製作者なことが多いので、頑張って翻訳しながら作業しよう。なんとかなる。

とまぁべた褒めしつつも、これほどの回数のアプデが来てもよくわかんねぇバグは唐突に起こるしマルチでの襲撃はクソ重いし犬は何年経っても最強すぎてブチギレちまうけど、それを抜きにしてもとても良い神サバイバルゲームなので、どうか一人でも多くプレイヤーが増えることを願ってます。

184047381.review:
7 Days to Die es una experiencia increíblemente adictiva y completa. Con más de 34 horas de juego, puedo decir que cada minuto ha valido la pena. Este juego mezcla de forma magistral la supervivencia, el crafteo, y el horror, ofreciendo una profundidad estratégica que mantiene enganchado en todo momento.

He logrado desbloquear 23 de los 43 logros, lo cual demuestra lo variado y desafiante que puede ser el juego. Cada logro se siente como una recompensa bien merecida, ya sea por sobrevivir hordas intensas, explorar biomas peligrosos, o construir fortalezas impresionantes. El sistema de progresión es satisfactorio y motiva a seguir explorando todas las posibilidades que ofrece.

La ambientación postapocalíptica y la dinámica de los siete días con la llegada de la horda son simplemente brillantes. Esto crea una sensación constante de tensión que te impulsa a planificar cuidadosamente tus recursos y movimientos.

Recomiendo este juego tanto para jugar en solitario como con amigos, ya que el multijugador añade una dimensión completamente nueva a la estrategia y diversión. Si te gustan los desafíos y la personalización en un mundo abierto, definitivamente este juego es para ti.

183935509.review: 7 Days to Die ist wie ein Survival-Abenteuer, bei dem du nie wirklich weißt, ob du mehr Angst vor den Zombies oder deinem eigenen Chaos hast! Zwischen dem Bauen, Craften und Überleben kämpft man gegen Horden von Zombies und versucht gleichzeitig, den täglichen Wahnsinn in Schach zu halten. Die Mischung aus Action, Strategie und gelegentlichen ‘Oh nein, warum habe ich das getan?’-Momenten macht das Spiel unglaublich unterhaltsam. Egal, ob du das Gefühl hast, ein Haus zu verteidigen oder einfach nur in den Wald zu fliehen, 7 Days to Die bietet ständig neue, spannende Herausforderungen. Es ist wie Minecraft, aber mit mehr Zombies und weniger Creepern – und das macht es einfach großartig!

I love this game.  
I don't think its worth the $70 NZD yet though. I think it was under $20 NZD when I bought it a couple years ago which is a fairer price.  

I've enjoyed the new updates and like the new progression system - I wish they added more vehicle and weapons however, as the play-time to get to "end game" is still pretty much the same and I feel that I finally get all the high tier weapons and vehicles and then run out of things to do soon after.

I know its not really anything to do with the developers but I wish there was a better system for hosting a 24/7 server - especially considering the XP boosts, this game is designed to be better with friends. There aren't many hosts that offer servers for this game and its an absolute pain in the ass to set one up, especially with mods.

Otherwise very epic.

183900686.review:
A great sandbox survival game that I have had the privlidge of watching grow. From back when this was a "zombie minecraft" with a somewhat cool XP system on PS4 which i 100%'d just when traders were first introduced to the legacy system, having played much before that, to where the game is today it truly is a labor of love and seeing their roadmap for the future and bringing console players up to today as well has been such a heartwarming sight. I highly recommend this is you have friends willing to play with you because it is so easy to lose track of time as you go out to complete missions or scavenge loot, or even fortify your base up for the next horde night and it tends to be much more enjoyable than not. It is even greater because there are several DOZENS of gameplay settings you can tweak about the world to make the experience just right for you whether you're a casual player that doesn't want their buildings destroyed to a complete gaming masochist that wants what would essentially become a no hit run, all the options are in there for you and the only thing that disables achievements for the completionists out there is enabling cheats!
Overall a fantastic survival crafting game that I will continue to play for years to come from time to time, seeing as across PS4 and PC I should be somewhere around having played this game for 7 different years now.

183874002.review:
7 Days to Die — это захватывающая игра для любителей испытаний, которые готовы погрузиться в атмосферу зомби-апокалипсиса. В этом суровом открытом мире вам предстоит не только сражаться с ходячими мертвецами, но и заниматься строительством, крафтом и управлением ресурсами.

Напряжённая атмосфера и постоянный риск придают игре особую остроту, а возможность играть в кооперативе с друзьями делает процесс ещё более увлекательным. Несмотря на некоторые технические недочёты, 7 Days to Die остаётся одной из лучших игр в своём жанре.

183849250.review:
I've been playing this game since it hit early access and for the longest time I couldn't bring myself to push passed the first weeks wave. I just wasn't connecting with the art direction or gameplay. But with Full Release 1.0, this game figured itself out. The art direction still might not be a vibe I jive with, but the gameplay loop is fire. 
Gunplay feels great and grows over time with different weapons and strengths along with perks you get through your character. Base growth is well done as you can either build your own or take over houses or businesses. Quests are retrieved from merchants and direct you around the map in natural ways to areas that give loot and conflict. The game keeps you engaged until the late stages and even then it still is engaging so long as you have a direction you want to take your base. 
It's hard to grow your character, but that's for good reason. Exploring is required to find what you need to get those upgrades you are looking for. Either to make better weapons, attachments, tools, workbenches, etc. The game wants you to leave your base and face the dangers of the world. It's not meant to hundle in one area until you rip it clean of everything it has.
Great game, great time, and still has updates coming. Worth every penny.

I have played this game a lot on earlier versions and, for years, it was fine. I enjoyed the updates providing fine tuned gameplay and improved graphics but sadly there is also that one thing I didn't paid for and I certainly didn't want : a new EULA.

When I purchased a license, I didn't agree for kernel level code running on my device to keep my solo sandbox game under surveilance. I didn't agree for this game to send informations attached to an hardware identifier to thrid parties based on a sketchy EULA that to my knownledge allows forced data collection for mostly any purpose, including marketing.

I cannot recommand a game that forces you into a new EULA so you can keep using a product you have already payed for.

183781240.review:
[h1]7 Days to Die Review – 132 Hours In[/h1]

[b]Rating:[/b] ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5)

After 132 hours in 7 Days to Die, this game has proven to be a brutally addictive survival sandbox that keeps you on edge. Whether you’re fortifying your base for the next blood moon or scavenging the wastelands for supplies, every moment feels like a test of your wits and resilience.

[hr][/hr]

[h2]Gameplay – Survival at Its Core[/h2]
At its heart, 7 Days to Die is a survival game that blends crafting, exploration, and tower defense mechanics seamlessly. The constant need to gather resources, build defenses, and fend off zombies keeps the gameplay loop engaging. The blood moon events crank up the tension and challenge, forcing you to constantly improve your strategies and adapt to the relentless hordes.

Combat feels gritty, with a satisfying mix of melee and ranged weaponry, and upgrading your skills makes progression feel meaningful. The ability to customize your base with traps, turrets, and intricate designs adds a layer of creativity that’s as rewarding as it is necessary.

[hr][/hr]

[h2]World – Vast and Unforgiving[/h2]
The open world of 7 Days to Die is expansive and filled with surprises, from abandoned towns to hidden loot caches. The environment is both a friend and foe—offering resources but punishing unprepared explorers with harsh weather and wandering zombie hordes. The dynamic day/night cycle adds urgency to every decision, as nighttime turns the zombies into terrifying predators.

[hr][/hr]

[h2]Highlights – What Stands Out[/h2]
✔️ Intense blood moon events that keep you strategizing.
✔️ Deep crafting and base-building systems.
✔️ A huge open world full of resources, danger, and secrets.
✔️ Skill trees that let you specialize in various playstyles, from combat to crafting.
✔️ Multiplayer adds a whole new level of chaos and fun with friends.

[hr][/hr]

[h2]Cons – Things to Keep in Mind[/h2]
❌ Graphics can feel outdated, but the gameplay more than makes up for it.
❌ Occasional bugs and glitches can disrupt immersion.
❌ The learning curve can feel steep for newcomers.

[hr][/hr]

[h2]Final Thoughts – A Survival Masterpiece[/h2]
7 Days to Die isn’t just a game—it’s an experience that constantly challenges and rewards you. With its deep systems, intense survival mechanics, and endless replayability, it’s a must-play for fans of the genre. Every blood moon feels like a fresh challenge, and every day survived feels like a hard-earned victory.

[b][u]Recommended[/u][/b] for anyone who loves survival games with depth, tension, and creativity!

[quote=Deelt]If you found this review helpful, please give it a like or an award! Thanks for reading, and happy surviving![/quote]

183777945.review:
Это одна из моих самых любимых игр. Я узнал о ней, когда в неё играл Фрост, и с тех пор мечтал прикоснуться к ней.

Каждое наше выживание с друзьями было неповторимым благодаря случайной генерации карты и, конечно же, возможности разрушать любые объекты на ней, включая саму карту.

Я очень рад, что разработчики продолжают работать над улучшением игры с каждым новым обновлением. Вы бы видели моё лицо, когда я впервые увидел новую генерацию городов — это было потрясающе! Ни одна другая игра о выживании не смогла подарить мне таких эмоций, как «7 дней».

Я очень надеюсь, что игра будет развиваться и становиться всё лучше и красивее с каждым новым обновлением.

183614771.review:
This game is a money-grabber, if you need to budget to buy games or even need to consider cost when buying games, do *not* get this. This game used to be less than 25 bucks at the exact same quality it is now. They released it from alpha just to call it a 'finished' game so that they could profit. The most recent update brought up an endlessly scrolling error screen in-game and crashed twice in a row on a new world within 5 minutes, so now I'm playing the update right before that to actually be able to play this game.

Graphics - I am not usually very picky when it comes to visuals but do not think it will look anything like it does in the previews without a lot of lag even on a decent pc. This game is just not optimized enough for that. The sky and shadows can look decent however the player avatars are very dated. I personally would also appreciate a bit more color variety to decrease the sense of monotony.

Design - I am not exaggerating when I say I am tired of killing the same 5-10 zombie skins over and over. They used to have the same problem with locations but that has improved recently, however the props tend to be extremely copy pasted and make it end up feeling like the same house/building every time just with a different layout.
- Zombies have a habit dramatically falling to the ground when they've taken a specific amount of damage which feels out of place and odd when it often doesn't line up with when you hit them. They don't suffer from knock-back when it feel like they are supposed to, and they have an extremely repetitive and predictable pattern of fall, get up, fall, get up 1-2 times in almost the exact same way for every single enemy.
- Instead of feeling like you are making it on your own like this "sandbox" wants to make you feel, game-play feels extremely attached to trader quests for early and mid game in order to make the game more playable. I have been told by long time fans of this game that this did not used to be the case and many aspects of this game have been nerfed for the sake of performance without actually doing much to actually improve it.
- There is no story or lore at all as far as I can tell, even post-release.

Leveling - If you don't increase Exp gain, this game can end up feeling very grindy, which combined with the lack of variety in enemies can make the early game more difficult to enjoy. I do like the skill points system however, and you can unlock a variety of different skills and specialize your character.

Balancing - This game needs to be re-balanced. There are a decent amount of facets to this game but some of them, such as vehicles, are locked behind having to be lucky enough to find specific rare items, rather than effort and skill. Even in the highest level locations, it is uncommon to find vehicle parts or some items that let you level up your weapons past Level 5.
- Farming is a good concept but crops grow so slowly that it's hard to sustain yourself off of them like the game likely intends you to be able to do. 
- Hunting is difficult due to the sheer lack of actual animals to hunt. They exist, but mostly you'll find the occasional runaway chicken or errant rabbit that certainly does not provide enough food or animal fat to utilize.

Conclusion - This game needs some serious updates before it's worth buying for more than 25 bucks. Some aspects of this game are promising but people who like this game have been asking for basic balancing, design, and performance improvements for a long time and seem to have been flat out ignored in favor of other, less fundamental changes that have steadily seemed to have alienated a large portion of this game's fanbase. The only reason I have played or will continue to play this game is because it was cheap when I got it originally. 
Thanks for your time.

183599339.review:
I've sank over 700 hours in this game. That's just what's on steam. I probably have maybe a third of that on Xbox before switching to PC several years ago. I've seen this game at it's best, worst, and best. Now? The game is not anything that I thought it would be.

New players probably were brought in from the "full release" announcement and ones that have received the Xbox update after many years due to the publisher/developer debacle. I'm happy for them. I certainly wished I had this game on Xbox up to the standards that it was brought to well before completely switching to PC, but I didn't. 

The new mechanics of the game about using magazines to open up blueprints is dogs**t. I hate everything about it. And it gets in the way of progression entirely. Which, by design, is supposed to be that way. And, it's completely random. Yes the perks "increase" the chances of you finding that specific magazine but it's all completely random due to the loot factor. It doesn't even work in any time of realistic perspective. Was your character a complete neanderthal before getting robbed of all your belongings???

I get it, the developers want people to sink time in the game and have it drawn out, but what's very egregious is that they don't give you any option to pick what loot system you want. There are 3 different loot systems that I have been through previous to this one through my years of playing. I liked some, hated others. Why not allow players to pick their progression system?? The foundation is already there! The ones like me who have played alpha version after alpha version know there can be options. But no, they obviously want the game to be played this way. And while that may be fine for some, it's not for me.

Also, this "full release" hype has been just complete hollow hype at it's worst. Yes, we get character customizing but beyond that, everything else is the exact same. Nothing has changed other than that. For Xbox players who have meme'd this game to death on Twitter/X about when's the next console update now have the game Steam users have. But Steam users who have been with this game for over the decade it's been in early access, have nothing new.

A fact on a feature I have been denied is we still have no human enemy NPC's, no raiders, nothing to fight against other than the zombies. Stuff that was in the Alpha's LONG ago as tests and things that TFP were announced we should have got. But no, they are still missing and no real foundation for it, other than a friendly follower which is the drone. Yet still broken even at full release.

The trader missions should have been a step in the right direction, not the main highway idea. I always felt the traders were useless in Alphas but it's good that they are able to be used. However, they are just an endless mission bank, something that keeps you busy between looting houses and horde nights. You don't get to build any affiliation with any of them, there is no special perk you get when you max out all the difficulty missions you complete, and it means jack-squat if you max out every traders mission. So ultimately, just a filler for your grinding needs.

Now, for the worst thing I hate about this game after so much time and effort has been put in this game by the developers with nothing to show for itself.

NO STORY

This point completely hurts. There is nothing in this game that gives you any story behind the madness that happened in 7D2D. No reason why blood moons happen, no reason why certain parts of the map are trashed in ruins, no reason why the zombies have mutated, NOTHING!!! This was something I wanted above everything else when I heard the full release was happening. I wanted reasons as to why things happened in this game. The game TRIED to do that from the very first second you get in the game. A little note that says "thanks for your stuff". But soon after the tutorial, that falls flat after finding the first trader.

TFP still treat this game as if it's STILL in early access. Adding things, fixing things, experimenting with things, and this game STILL can't find it's foothold against being an adult version of Minecraft. The calling for 7 Days to Die for me is long gone and even with me just being a casual player after haven't 700+ hours in this game, I will still continue to play it with a blind hope that eventually I will start up a new save and be completely blown away. But I seriously doubt it since it took so long for the game to come this far.

However, this review shouldn't be considered a slander on the game itself, but against The Fun Pimps for not only taking 11 years to move this from Alpha to full release, but for there to be nothing to show for it other than better models, better graphics, and a broken loot system with a hollow to non-exisitent storyline. 

I recommend this to players that have ever wanted to try this game, at least. But only buy this game when it's on sale, and a heavy one at that. Any veteran player will still desire to play this game with new players, but they will not want you to pay full price. At least, they shouldn't, considering if they have spent as much time or more into this game than I have. And new players are the only thing that will excite veterans into getting back into this game.

As for The Fun Pimps, I expected much better than this. I've been excited for what you could have brought to this game for so long but ultimately left me disappointed in not only your progress of this game, but total lack of regard of what the some of the community has expected of you and wanted out of it, even though we stuck with you for as long as they have. You could look at the hours I have spent into this game and call it a success, but you should see this as insight from someone that will probably never believe you again on the next game you make.

183583431.review:
If you enjoy long-term upgrading and favor strategy over brute-force, I would recommend this game.

There are both guns and melee for people who enjoy each. However, keep in mind that all weapons in the game become obsolete as soon as you can make the next generation of weapon. So if you really like the lever action, that's too bad because it will never be as good as the next rifle you unlock. Really like how the hunting knife feels? Too bad-- the machete is better in every way except it's not as fun. Keep that in mind before you buy the game. It is not an RPG.

I will say that the game is far more fun with friends. There are certain mechanics such as traits that specifically encourage multiplayer, but it is totally optional.

Probably the most confusing part of the game for new players is how much information the game does not tell you. There are many mechanics you won't learn about unless you learn them from the internet or figure them out with trial and error. This has its ups and downs.

Overall a fun and worthwhile experience with a huge learning curve.

183565271.review:
このゲームマジでおすすめです。
良い点は自由度が高いので飽きない・スキルがあるので自分の好きな武器のスキルを上げて無双したりできる点・ブロックなどの形状が豊富でマイクラみたいに建築を楽しむ事もできます。それにMODも豊富にあるのでバニラに飽きたらMODを入れて遊んでみて下さい。
悪い点は武器が少ない事と終盤になるとあまりやることがない事です。ですがMODで解決できるので、良くない点は少ないと思います。強いていうなら正式版になってから急に価格が上昇した事ぐらいですけど結構な頻度でセールが来るのであまり気にしなくていいかな？

まとめ、伝えるのが下手ですみません、僕が言いたいのはこのゲームはとても楽しいのでぜひやってみて欲しいって事です。マルチでワイワイやるのも良しシングルプレイでガチ装備にするのもおよしの何でもありゲーなのでみんなもやってみてね

183561177.review:
Я начинала гамать когда игра была в бете тесте. На пиратке отыграла часов 700 и здесь  немножко))) 

Что Я могу сказать. Не ожидала что игра выйдет с бета теста так быстро)))) молодцы разрабы))) 
Теперь игра глючит на любом качестве, хотя изначально играла на ультрах, теперь самые низкие настройки. Ах*уеть подгон, ребят))))) 

Игра про то как ты появляешься, тебя любят и любят всякие зомбари)) потом ты строишься получаешь оружее тебя продолжают любить и любить зомби, собаки, волки, медведи и люди   всем кому не лень)))) на 7 ночь приходит целая орда и тебя любят ещё сильнее только дружной толпой)))) особенно вам понравится чувак с динамитом, отвечаю))) мой любимый персонаж в игре. Люблю ❤😘  ты строишь базу несколько игровых дней, а эта падаль приходит в 5 и начинают хуя*рить взрывать всё что плохо стоит))) с каждым обновлением эти твари всё умнее и умнее. Они начинают получать интеллект в скором времени такое ощущение будто будут бить е*бальники в реале 

Игра сплочает команду. Настолько что к концу 7 дня вы пиздите друг друга в команде, забывая про орду полу орков на подходе. Ибо пару человек валяют дурака и просто шляются где-то 7 дней, остальные пропадают в шахтах, а патроны принести было некому. 🖤🖤🖤🖤🖤🖤 просто пушка. Особенно команда любит друг друга когда выбирают где будут жить занимать или строить, как и где всё должно лежать. Кто будет плавить и крафтить, кто фармить, кто на готовке )))) распределение ролей идёт таким образом. Что никто нихуя делать не хочет и вы друг на друга орете забывая о сути игры а принципе. 
Игра 1000030404040/10

Не качайте. Вы потеряете своих друзей и найдете их в расте)))))) и потом снова потеряете)))))

183530584.review:
Actually the game is fun but.....
The last time I had played 3 years ago and for me it took some time to get used to the new level-up-system: Collecting magazins to progress. After a while I understood the approach and  slowly the fun started: Find new places, investiate, get jump scared, fight closed to death and get rewarded ... or leave the place with wounds and shame... or dead.  I progressed slowly but I each day there was a progress. I managed the food and weapon issues by choosing the right skills and slowly the first blood moon night came closer. There was not much time to prepare my shelter appropriately, thus I decided to clear a rigid building (mausleum) and moved in.... at least  for the 1st blood moon. It worked very well  and I decided to make this to my new home. From now, the game was really fun and challenging. I progressed my skills and my fortress and and each difficulty of the first days  slowly disappeared. But then, I got big trouble: infection. Best solution: antibioticum or natural one like honey ... but I couldn't find some. I bought it from the trader but the infection was already progressed so I needed  real antibioticum and so I had to made a tough decision: Clear the nearby military base to get it.  No sooner said than done. I walked to the place, sneaky in the beginning, pipe bomb throwing in the end but somehow I could escape the place alive...somehow. I was very closed to death and I had to go back quickly to my shelter to recover. To this moment I felt very exciting and it was really happy to manage the escape. But then... I entered close to death  my fortess - my save fortress with all the healing items, food and water and no zombie around. Stupid. Apperently, my safe space was reseted. Each zomby I had killed one week ago (ingame time) was suddenly there again! Did I mention I was close to death without expecting bad sursprises?  Of course I died and as if that's not enouh  my place was occupied - no chance to reach my stuff and blood moon no. 2 was only 1 day ahead. All in all, rage quit and writing this review to calm down. 7d2d is always a fun experience but there are still reasons to pause for another three years. I was close to spend my holiday with this game but the moment I described was too frustrated to me.  I recommend this game anyway but be ready to get frustrated.

183528908.review: This game has definitley had its ups and downs dont get me wrong, but recently the devs have done a completly outstanding job of working on this game and updating. This is such a fun game and easily spend 50 plus hours on a single world. The progression system is easy to learn, fun and makes sense. every game you play can be totally different and it always feels fresh starting a new world. Every world you make you can set all sorts of paramaters like general difficulty to loot abundance to town generation and even horde night zombie counts and run speeds. I highly reccomend this game and i have hundreds of hours on Xbox as well.
